Reviews.Title: “Excellenet service”
Reviews.Author: Cosmicmerc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a bit off the center but nothing is too far in Amsterdam city. Very professional and helpful front desk staff. Excellent service! The rooms are very clean and spacious. Overall a very good city hotel as you can come accross some very bad ones in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Seriously efficient Ibis Stopera, DFDS and the Holland Pass.”
Reviews.Author: Pontevecchio
Reviews.Content: The Ibis City Stopera was seriously efficient... but friendly and welcoming. The breakfast selection was everything you'd need, beds comfortable and very clean and well looked after. Great free internet access from the lobby computers hooked to a printer to print out directions and places to visit. Ideally get a room number on the canal side of the hotel ending with a 9 or an 11 so you get a bay window overlooking the canal. The hotel is in a good location, 10-15 mins walk to the Centraal Station for trams. We walked to Anne Frank's House, the Van Gogh Museum and Rembrantplatz. Good market round the corner on Sunday morning where you could buy an old second hand Dutch bike for not much more than hiring one for a week... then just sell it back the next week-end! If you have a couple of days to fit lots in, buy a Holland Pass and get the 5 [44 euros] or 7 pass ticket per person from the office in the station concourse, you get red [tulip] and blue [windmill] passes to attractions which save significantly on the entry prices with Rapid access to some museums. The Blueboat Canal Tour was worth it [Blue pass] 1hr 40mins. We got local buses out to Keukenhof Gardens for the Bulb Shows [until 2nd week in May] using the Holland Pass tickets. No.179 out to Schipol Airport then a No.58 to the Gardens. We travelled over on the DFDS Ferry overnight... great buffet breakfasts and the 7 Seas buffet is a great tasting introduction to more varied North European food- pickled herring and marinated salmon... lovely. The Blue Riband restaurant on the way back was an extravagance but worth it! ...though the food portions in the Bake'n Coffee cafe were fantastic- especially the chips with ketchup and mustard mayo! We'll definitely recommend Ibis Stopera, DFDS to extend your holiday for 2 stress-free nights rather than flying, and the Holland Pass!

Reviews.Title: “good clean place”
Reviews.Author: specialbrew1979
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a while ago forgot to leave review .Stayed here in may2011 with 10 friends for my stag do we had rooms with 3 twin beds which is ideal for larger groups and makes it abit cheaper.The hotel is everything you would expect from an ibis hotel,basic,but very clean and with enough comfot for a short break .The hotel is just a short walk to rembrandt square ,and about a15min walk to dam square and red light.

Reviews.Title: “Problem-free Accomodation”
Reviews.Author: wilkinsonld
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, clean rooms, comfy beds, ideally situated - who could ask for more? The bar staff are fun and very welcoming, even to our fifteen-strong English stag party. The hotel is ideal for those who like to be near the action but away from the noise. Twenty minute walk from the railway station, five minute walk to the Rembrandt Museum, ten minute walk to Rembrandt Square (which I think is infinitely more pleasing than Dam Square). Loved the shower - even though I was just a human stag, there was enough room for an actual stag in the shower.

Reviews.Title: “A short stay at Ibis Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Trmia
Reviews.Content: The average standard of the Ibis chain of hotels. Small basic rooms are kept clean with good heating system. The location is not in a mainstream area but can be reached to the tourist areas by foot or public transport. Ideal service we got during out stay at this hotel, apart from when we were checking out on our last day, (my partner just stepped out of the hotel for a quick smoke and got nagged upon by the manager on early morning duty shift that our taxi would be arriving in a few minutes and were told to remain in the hotel lobby. Rude for a staff to be doing that!). In future, I would only stay in this hotel chain if there is nothing else available around the same price range.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly and near the city centre”
Reviews.Author: ElderlemonDublin
Reviews.Content: I'd recommend this hotel for 3 reasons above. Our room although basic was spotless on arrival. We found the staff to be friendly and didn't mind our poor Dutch! It's also only a 10 minute ramble to Dam centre. You can get a taxi from the central station to the hotel but it took us about 15 minutes to walk to. It can be pricey in Amsterdam, but if you book early you can get a decent price for a room here that it's in a thriving City that's a must see on your Journeys way, this Hotel is a good place to start!

Reviews.Title: “A bit far from center but good”
Reviews.Author: dulac7
Reviews.Content: I found it a bit far from center, but it was silent, clean and the room was small but nice. Close to the Artis Zoo though. We tried to find a place to eat nearby and failed, only coffee-shops that serves no coffee (LOL) and that didn't interest us. But there is a supermarket on the corner so we bought something there. Staff was nice and gave us a free city map. We had pasta at the restaurant but I didnt like it, I dont think I can call that tomato sauce.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: tonyfromdeal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ibis Stopera for 2 reasons - firstly it offered a good price (204 Euros for 3 nights for 2 people) and secondly its location - it is far enough out of the city centre to be quiet but close enough to still walk everywhere. With the IBIS you know what you are getting - small but clean rooms - free wi-fi was good but breakfast and drinks are expensive. We never ate at the hotel as there are loads of cafes and restaurants within walking distance. I don't need to go on about Amsterdam because everyone knows it all by now. We had a lovely time there with friends and would recommend this hotel to anyone who is planning a trip there.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay there again anytime”
Reviews.Author: cancze
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean and professional all around. The breakfast buffet in the restaurant is the usual continental selection. The food quality is quite good. The room was clean with a safe and a very nice ensuite bathroom that had a comfortably sized shower stall. My only complaint about the room was that the closet space was a bit lacking for two people sharing the room. The real appeal of this hotel is in it's location. It's within easy walking distance of the centre and the port area.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kitsunegari
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the 3rd time in 5 years. As usual the staff are friendly and helpful and the rooms clean and tidy. Breakfast is ok, with plenty of choice and the hotels location is great for seeing all parts of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly and convenient”
Reviews.Author: djoneill21
Reviews.Content: Our group of 8 stayed here from Friday to Sunday. The hotel is a short walk to Dam Square and the red light district. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was basic but very clean. The dinner in the hotel was very tasty, and after a late night on the town they have pizzas on offer in reception. Amsterdam Central train station is within walking distance, and this connects to the Airport. We got a taxi from the Airport to the Hotel, around â‚¬55. I would have no problems staying here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good accommodation, good location”
Reviews.Author: SwimmingSeas
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at this hotel and were quite satisfied. It was spotlessly clean, quiet (we had a view to a kind of inner yard and were on the fifth floor) and confortable. By Ibis standards, the room and bathroom size were good, the TV larger than usual and the wardrobe space, though small, much more adequate than other hotels from the same chain. We had an extra pillow, which was handy, because we would have asked for one anyway. There was wireless internet available, but no minibar. We didnâ€™t get breakfast and in the evenings the restaurant looked a bit dark and unwelcoming. It was usually populated by small noisy groups having drinks. Staff were helpful. The location is very good. Railway station is within walking distance if travelling light and the city center and many attractions are also a short walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Bruntysnr
Reviews.Content: We had a 3 night stay at this hotel to celebrate my birthday. We arrived late morning and were allowed entry to our 6th floor canal view room immediately. We asked for and received two extra pillows. All sparkling clean. Entry to the lifts is by room key for security. Bed very comfortable (pillow top) TV fine...I like to watch adverts in other countries (saddo). They lasted 8 minutes at a stretch! Breakfasts were good...plenty of choice to vary day by day. Free to use computers in the lobby and restaurant (Italian themed) which were timed to last 20 minutes but if no one was waiting, I just logged in again. We had a problem printing our flight boarding pass but the receptionist helped and did it for us. 10 minutes very brisk walk to Dam square but we sauntered. Also near to main harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, hard beds and loud cleaning staff.”
Reviews.Author: Dman999
Reviews.Content: The title pretty much says it all. The hotel was clean and modern. Great location, market close by and metro about 2 blocks away, or they have bikes you can rent. The beds were very firm to the point of being uncomfortable and the noise from the cleaning ladies was loud so don't plan on sleeping in. I would not recommend the pasta restaurant at the hotel, the lasagna was under cooked...twice.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with helpful staffs and many conveniences”
Reviews.Author: Wiwien
Reviews.Content: We arrived Amsterdam at dawn and were aware that we were too early to check in, but the staff allowed us to check in and rest after a long filght, another reception staff help me printed my return flight online check-in. A restaurant staff served me a complimentary hot chocollate when I was shivering by the october rain and wind...They do not gave much smile, but many actions instead. Last but not least, the hotel had quite many links to other services (airport transfer services, tours, etc) that made my staying there convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best, not the worst. A little disappointed, but not the worst time.”
Reviews.Author: pierodavila
Reviews.Content: Well, it's an Ibis Hotel, so the maximum you can expect is a Ibis Hotel. So, here it goes: - The room is a little tight for 3 people, so be aware of that. - the air conditioning system of our room was not working properly, and the room was too damn hot. I asked the front desk to fix it, but nobody did anything. Not the best attitude with customers here. - the food in the restaurant was awful, but the waiter was very helpful. - Good location, near Rembrandt-plein. A little weird at night, but ok.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect what more can you ask for”
Reviews.Author: brianandvicky
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my girlfriend for a night when doing a 3 night mini cruise. And for value for money this hotel is spot on. Everything is around the hotel that you need. Dam square only 10 min walk, shops just on the corner and it is a big supermarket (like a tesco). The breakfast are perfect. Warm fresh coisants and standard full English ( well there version) buffet. Rooms are very clean and shower/ steamroom where amazing after walking round dam all day. Would definatly return. Using ibis hotels again when going to Dublin

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend”
Reviews.Author: BILLG28
Reviews.Content: We had a really enjoyable weekend in the Stopera. Excellent service from friendly and helpful staff. Hotel room was very clean and comfortable with pod style bathroom (which we liked and didn't find too small!). No wardrobe or drawers but reasonable hanging space and storage shelves. Flat screen TV and (free) safe. Very good breakfast buffet with hot and cold dishes and plenty of choice. Though in a relatively quiet area, the hotel is very well located for walking to the city centre and tram and metro stops nearby made for easy access to other parts. Very near to large supermarket, Rembrandt's House Museum and Gasson Diamond Factory, the nearest stop for the Hop-on Hop-off City Sightseeing tour, which is a great way to see Amsterdam, especially if on a short trip like we were (26 euros for all day ticket on bus and one hour canal cruise). Liked best - location and staff. Liked least - only (very minor) criticism is that the TV channel choice in English is very limited, with only BBC World service and Eurosport (which didn't really matter, but I really can't think of anything else I didn't like!).

Reviews.Title: “Nice Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: it was really great stay i enjoyed the hotel and all services provided , staff were so helpful and cooperative , i would recomment everyone to stay there , it is less than 5 min away from train and tram stations , which makes it very comfortable to go around

Reviews.Title: “Great one night stay.”
Reviews.Author: Jamndug
Reviews.Content: Our family of four (2 adults and 2 kids - 7&9yrs)) drove into Amsterdam at 1600 in search of an overnight accomodation close to the city centre and not priced through the roof. Of course, we realised we would not pay pre-booked or discount price, but we found (eventually) the Ibis Stopera. It is a great for us with a central location, car parking next door, clean rooms, good service and breakfast included. Only issue was we were required to get two rooms as they are all twins only and no interconnecting were available. Howevere, the advantage was it made for a nice night without the kids. Sure it might have been a bit pricey, but hey, we were a walk-up family, very close to the centre or Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “perfect for amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: hotel very well located. very close by walking to centre. restaurant service not very good, the chef came to our table to take our order as he wanted to go home. want I started to tell him my choice, he just replied "I don't have that" so I picked something else and he said "I don't have that". He was not able to tell me what he had, he just wanted to give me something easy for him to do. fortunately, the food was OK.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for short stay but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Oasisgirl80
Reviews.Content: Plus points - clean, modern room, beds ok (if a little on the hard side), good location within walking distance of all the main sites. Minuses - room was really overheated, and because it was on a main road, you couldn't sleep with the window open. Ibis is a budget chain, and if I get a cheap rate I feel satisfied. This however was very expensive - but then Amsterdam is a very expensive city so they can get away with charging high prices. Food and drinks are excessively expensive so eat out, and if you need a drink in your room, be sure to pick up water from the supermarket - we forgot and got stung for about 5 or 6 euros through having to get it at the hotel bar.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gogigboy
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here on numerous occasions. a ten minute walk from the main square. Staff very friendly, nice bar, clean rooms, usual Ibis. The is a Chinese massage shop a few doors away, great foot massage for 25 Euro, highly recommended. Definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A centre location in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: masrura
Reviews.Content: Stay in Ibis Stopera Amsterdam was very exciting experience. Even as the budget hotel Ibis have minimise facilities to offerred but you would have a good stay with them. The location was my first choice. Only a short walking distance from Central station and Dam square its easy to go around the city. Albert heinz supermarket is only 200m on the left side hotel. The breakfast was wonderful with many various choice. But as a budget hotel, they have not provided such as mineral water, tea or coffee making facility, but you can get a hot water in the cafe near the Lobby. They only provide soap and shampoo in the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “My stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: bobd46 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not located in a mainstream area. Good dining area and main tourist areas are within easy reach by foot or public transport. The hotel has small clean rooms with good showers. Not much room for suitcases if you are travelling with partner. The bed is hard, which can effect sleep. Breakfast is expensive and is not value for money. Room tariff is a little high for the room size. In future would only use this hotel chain if nothing else was available for around the same price. Recommended with reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough for what you pay”
Reviews.Author: FotisAthens Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed there on Eastern with family (me, my wife and our two kids, 2,5 & 1,5 years old). Hotel is good, clean and close to the city center. Our room was on the top floor and was big enough for our needs. As i l know, room's in Ibis hotels are small. Our room at this one was big. It's location is very close to the city center and just a few steps (3-4 minutes walk) from the closest tram stop and the closest metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and good value”
Reviews.Author: DCtraveler1691
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on business. My room was small - almost like a dorm. Not much room for clothing and had to get on one of the beds to open the window. Bathroom was adequate - good size shower, but small sink. Very loud toilet. VERY CLEAN. A bit dated. TV channels were ok - a few languages available. Room had 3 twin beds. I was paying a group rate - only 86 Euros a night. Wireless internet rate was very inexpensive - about 11 Euros for 3 days worth. Good location - near subway and bus lines. Close to the Maritime Museum and Nemo. Staff was excellent and helpful. Beds were comfortable but the pillows were too hard for me. My room had 3 single beds in it - making it crowded. I would stay here again if traveling alone - would be too small to stay with others. Good restaurant for dinner. Supermarket and good coffee shop and bagel shop within 10 min walk. I was not able to check in early - it really depends upon how busy they are. But they were able to lock the baggage up while I went out for the day. Front desk took care of everything flawlessly - calling taxis, making dinner reservations (strongly recommended) and providing internet connectivity. Room was very clean. Overall good deal if you don't mind a small space and little to no frills. Worth the walk or taxi to Humphrey's for dinner. Best bargain in town.

Reviews.Title: “Quick break in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: pcworks
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Amsterdam for a night and 2 days, we booked this hotel using IBIS's own booking website that gave us a good discount if you prepaid before your visit. We paid â‚¬91 for a standard room, which for a central Amsterdam hotel was a good price. We arrived at the hotel just before 11.00am so we expected just to drop the suitcase off at the hotel and check in later, as earliest check-in was 2pm, but we were pleasantly surprised to get the room early and we were given a canal view room at the rear of the hotel. The hotel was quiet and it was a midweek booking as well. The room was a good size and very clean. Good flat screen TV mounted on the wall and wifi access was available for â‚¬3.95 for a 24hr period. The location of the hotel was excellent in a nice residential area on Valkenburgerstraat opposite the fire station. The hotel charges â‚¬15 per person for breakfast in the hotel restaurant, but there is a nice cafe called the Cafe De Valk about 50metres past the hotel who do an excellent breakfast for â‚¬6.95 and the cappuccino was superb. The hotel restaurant does a good Italian menu but we ate out in the evening in small restaurant on Damstraat. The location of the hotel is very good, 15mins walk from Dam Square and the Oude Kerk. We are hoping to go back to Amsterdam again next year, as we enjoyed our time there and have still so much more to see there.

Reviews.Title: “Great if your up for a walk!!”
Reviews.Author: Themadhatter1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean, comfy and the staff were great. Able to check in before 12!! Must be fit as we needed to do a lot of walking to get to where we wanted, especially if you don't want to do the tours or trams.

Reviews.Title: “Another reliable Ibis”
Reviews.Author: SimplyRojo Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I chose the Ibis as they've always been good to me in the past (Singapore, Paris). This one was no exception. It has a reasonably good location (close to tram, metro and walking distance to Rembrant Square and the old town/red light district, although it's not itself in the thick of the action). The rooms are standard Ibis configuration, with standard Ibis bathroom. They are very clean and comfortable enough. The only drawbacks of this particular one were the lack of a fridge and tea/coffee making facilities, which are I`ve had at other Ibis hotels in the past. Ultimately, the price is excellent for the quality in what is an expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Little Ibis”
Reviews.Author: euroweekenders
Reviews.Content: As Amsterdam hotel prices seem to be getting more and more expensive this group of hotels offers room at a fair rate.......if you book in advance / look for offers (we paid 90 euros a night for twin bedroom). We found that it was actually closer than we thought to the centre (10 minute walk to Rembandtplein.depends which quarter you think is the centre). It's adjacent to a few bars, supermarket, canal-side coffee shops (that is...coffee to drink) but so much more just a walk away. The room was cosy (end of October) and clean. The bed well dressed in white cotton and very comfortable. More than the other two Ibis hotels we've stayed in this one had a flat screen TV built into a flat unobtrusive unit on the wall which worked a treat. The room was well soundproofed (we had neighbours either side but we couldn't hear a thing)) with double glazing and a thick main door (please guide these closed guests as they are so heavy they close with a thud....it's the only hard sound you hear if guests allow the door to slam closed behind them). The pod-style bathroom is also spotless and the shower had endless constant hot water. These fabulous all-in-one bathroom pods would be better if when fitted they were lined with insulating material 1st as they do make even the most nimble inside-shower manoeuvres sound lie a mule trying to kick it's way out of a barn. We didn't pay to have breakfast. We prefered to get up, shower and get out but from what I could see by the breakfast area lay-out it's seems quite low-key for the hefty 15 euro per person charge. Also, we had a pint (well half a litre) of lager one night and it was a hefty 5.50 euros eachOther Ibis hotels we've stayed at in the UK had tea/coffee making facilities in the room. Maybe they don't in Europe but we did miss having a cuppa in the room in the morning when we thought the facilities would be the same UK to Europe. One last thing...the reception area is truly warm and welcoming as are all the employees you happen to meet and they can't do enough to help you. I will definately be using this Ibis again...maybe next time I'll pack my travel kettle.

Reviews.Title: “In the middle of nowhere”
Reviews.Author: Buddhakkan
Reviews.Content: I am surprised that this hotel has such high ratings. It is in the middle of no where, not connected by either the city car / trams or buses, the nearest metro is over a 10 mins walk. Central, Dam everything is atleast a 20 mins plus walk depending on your stride. The only thing close to this hotel is Nemo the science museum. Rooms are small, bathrooms tiny. The housekeeping did not clean our room the first day. I have never stayed at a IBIS before so canâ€™t compare but it did not seem value for money compared the other hotels in our Europe trip. We went to Interlaken and Paris too which are supposed to be more expensive than Amsterdam. What is nice about this hotel are the staff at the reception, who are friendly. That aside I will give this place a miss.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: NewcastleMarkone
Reviews.Content: We have recently spent 3 nights at this hotel. The service from the staff was excellent and they were very friendly. The rooms were very clean and comfortable.As for location the hotel is only 5 minutes walk to the center.Would recommend this hotel for anyone looking for a reasonably priced hotel in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Ibis with dutch specific”
Reviews.Author: Rambus
Reviews.Content: Hotel is situated not so close to center, but you still don't need to use transport to reach it. Rooms are smaller than usual and quite expensive, but almost everything in Holland is more expensive than in countries around it. Service is standart for Ibis hotels: bathroom and TV-set in the room, same furniture and room design as in other Ibis hotels, breakfast isn't usually included in room price and don't worth money they want for it. WiFi isn't free and is expensive too so be ready. This was one of the cheapest hotel in Amsterdam with availible triple rooms so if you'll take a trip to Amsterdam and need just a place to stay, this hotel is good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Newly renovated hotel but somewhat lacking...”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located and is a walking distance to shops and entertainment. The pics and the reviews of hte hotel stated that it was "newly renovated" so we expected it to be "modern" at least. The room was modern, but lacked the up-market feel. No carpets in the room - wooden laminate floors, which made it seem like a hospital room. The room was clean with new shower and bed - although the bed was a bit strange, with no base for the bed, the mattress and base were combined so it is impossible to fit a sheet to this - with the effect that every night the sheet that was "placed" on the bed kept on moving and getting "tangled" and really frustrating us breaking our sleep constantly. As if that was not enough, every morning at around 06h30 or so, the cleaner just had to start vacuuming in the passage ways causing a noise and waking us up - this was EVERY morning without fail! The walls in htis hotel are thin! I mean really thin! We could hear the people above us and next to us clearly...the room to our right had a group of guys who came in at around 3am every night and made a noise, and hte room to our left had a young family who woke us up (if the vacuuming did not wake us up already) really early as well. Was not expecting a a 7 star experience, but a decent bed and a good night's sleep is not too much to ask for. The hotel is still undergoing some renovations, so it looking new, but I would consider very carefully before staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great room but no aircond...”
Reviews.Author: Tiong15
Reviews.Content: I spend overnight in this hotel after arriving in Amsterdam using DFDS cruise. The transfer from the port to the hotel is nice and took about 30 minutes. The coach stop right in front of the hotel which is a plus. Check in is fast and the check in lady is brilliant and helpful. Would give her a very good rating. She is the one with the shorter hair. The room is clean but the only problem is it is not aircond (maybe is ibis) and the way to cool the room down is by opening the window. This can be very noisy if your room is facing the main street. Location is not that brilliant. It takes roughly 5-10 minutes walk to the tram stop and supermarket and 20 minutes to the chinatown. The breakfast is good as well. May not pick this hotel again due to no aircond and location wise.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: N0rbert Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The IBIS standard you can always count on. Good value, small but clean and comfortable rooms. Within walking distance to all city attractions, restaurants, night life. Easy access from Schiphol via Amsterdam Centraal.

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fine. as was my room. Having a canal outside the window is great. The only complaint was the 4.50 euro charge for a small bottle of water.xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: stephen A
Reviews.Content: Very clean hotel, staff very helpful, comfortable rooms nice with canal views, only thing missing that would of been good was coffee and tea facilities. Breakfast was very good and plenty of selection. Slightly a bit further out than we thought from bars and attractions but not a problem nice and peaceful during the night. Travelled with dfds from newcastle it was good value and would do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was easy to find and at check in we were welcomed and given some local information and a handy map. Rooms had everything we needed and were clean and cosy. The only negative was that they got too warm at times. Bathrooms were also clean and well equipped with shower gel and a hairdryer. We only tried food from the bar menu (paninis, toasties, wraps) which was lovely - I'm sure the restaurant food would be even better. There are also vending machines in the hotel and a Spar less than 2 mins away. Location was great, and we would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice!”
Reviews.Author: Veslo
Reviews.Content: Very good location, clean and quiet, breakfast was OK.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotels location was good as it was right in the middle of central and flower market and we got the room with canal view. Room was nice and clean. Friendly staff and very helpful. Would definitely consider this hotel again if I ever go to Amsterdam again

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay, would recommend”
Reviews.Author: scotsman2011
Reviews.Content: Just stayed 4 nights in the Ibis Stopera and we enjoyed our stay here. Enjoyed the location, close enough to all the goings on in the centre but nice and quiet away from the crowds that are there, if you get what I mean! The room was smaller than we are used to but served the purpose well. Comfortable beds, decent storage space for clothes, a good shower and an in room safe. With a bonus view on the canal ! Breakfast was decent, we had it included in our package but I think the 15 Euros cost if not included is a bit overpriced. Ate in the restaurant one night, the food was good but again I think a bit overpriced. Internet free for 1 hour a day or 3.95 euros for 24 hours. The staff are very friendly here and are always willing to help Away from the hotel , the Artis zoo is only a 5 minute walk away and is well worth a visit! If I were to return to Amsterdam again I would stay again here for sure

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdam business trip”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Booked a double room but got three single beds as did my colleagues so getting used to single beds made sleep difficult. Parking was expensive at 70 Euros for two days. Appart from that a good hottel by Amsterdam standards.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced for what it offered”
Reviews.Author: 36bay37
Reviews.Content: This IBIS was a typical IBIS but we found it way overpriced for what it offered. For 180 euros (about $240/night through booking.com), the room was clean and adequate but certainly not luxurious in any way. Neither breakfast nor Internet was included in the price and it felt like we were being ripped off even though it was our own choice to stay there. On the positive side, the location was convenient and the facility was nice looking. If you do book though, BE SURE to ask for a room in the back. The front is very noisy with traffic going by all night. NOTE: about booking.com: They claim to have a â€œbest price guaranteeâ€� but when I referred them to hotels.com where the cost was considerably less, they insisted that hotels.com did not include taxes when it clearly stated that it did. Unfortunately, I did not notice the difference in rate until we were already booked in. I will not book with booking.com again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, value and friendly staff :-)”
Reviews.Author: LoveStalis06
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and found it to be very comfy and good value for money. Breakfast was included in our stay and on the first morning we went down quite early and struggled to get a table so for the next two mornings we went down about 10am-10.30am and it was less hectic and there was still plenty of food available. We've stayed in Ibis hotels before in the UK so knew what to expect from the rooms and for two people they are comfy enough and there's enough space. The bathroom was also big enough for two and the shower was lovely. It was also close to town only about a 10 min walk and about 20 mins to Dam Square. We would stay here again if we ever go back to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad budget option”
Reviews.Author: JamieW
Reviews.Content: Actually stayed here unintentionally. Booked in haste and thought i was booking Ibis by Centraal Station. However this one much brighter, fresher. Much more modern bathroom. It's basic because it's an Ibis. But room size ok, ckean, bright. Good location. Friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great service & view”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here. The service, food and the view from our room of the canal and houses across the canal is beautiful. The staff are friendly and there is a good full breakfast, we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “nice and clean and no nonsense”
Reviews.Author: Andydrewbra
Reviews.Content: was stuck here on a unplanned layover due to hurricane irene pleasent clean room and no nonsense reasonabley quiet but i would imagine it getting noiser with more stoners around earlier in the season, close to city and there is a spar shop near by if you dont feel like spending 6 euros for breakfast good friendly staff and happy to help in anyway they can.. :) the rooms could do with a fridge if you were wanting to save money on food but that is the only complaint :)

Reviews.Title: “Small room, bathroom smells”
Reviews.Author: Extech
Reviews.Content: "Ibis standard" very small rooms. The all plastic bathroom smells. There is no air circualiton (exhaust for the bath) during night time. Breakfast is really limited...

Reviews.Title: “Good quality hotel for the price. Good breakfasts!!!”
Reviews.Author: hamlettphil
Reviews.Content: Myself and 12 of my friends stayed here for a stag weekend. We stayed for 3 nights and paid 150 euros each, i think this is very reasonable for a hotel in a european capital. Breakfast was included in the price, which was a good selection of food too. Rooms were comfy and even thought the bathroom was small, the shower was very spacious. No complaints here. the only downside i thought was the hotel advertised free wifi in the lobby, however i could not get it through my phone ( this is not the 1st hotel i have encountered this however). But there is a computer in the lobby which is 1 euro for about 15 minutes of web time. The hotel is about 15-20 minutes walk from dam square Overall good decent hotel, away from the noisy red light area. would reccomend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Exciting !”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: It was a good location and we also checked out more of non-tourist atractions! We had the opportunity to walk a lot and the bus 59 from the central station took us in few minutes (5-10). Really easy way! If possible ask for the canal view from your hotel room which is beautiful! Also, the breakfast is worth paying.

Reviews.Title: “Good solid well-run hotel”
Reviews.Author: fluffytapeworm
Reviews.Content: You might think twice about booking this hotel as on the map it looks a little far out from the centre of historic Amsterdam. Not so. It is served directly by buses and is easy to walk to from Centraal Station. It is very clean and secure, the beds are amazingly comfortable and the staff are very helpful and friendly. We got a room facing the canalside which gave us a beautiful view. There are just two downsides to the hotel - the breakfast is a whopping 15 euros pp, and the corridors tend to be echoey. So - eat in any of the fab places in Amsterdam eg Tisfris just round the corner, or buy in from the huge supermarket on the corner.......and run the a/c at night to make a soothig backgroound noise. worked for me. Outside a couple of doors down some apartments seem to have been taken over by anarchist squatters who have messed up the place with graffiti. When you've just arrived and are maybe tired and tense it might make you think you've booked into a crummy area but nothing could be further from the truth.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: amadorak
Reviews.Content: the hotel is quite good and the staff is very friendly. the room was clean and in good condition and also a nice size. My friends stayed in ibis in central station the the rooms was much smaller but the location was much better. so location wise is ok if you don't mind to walk a bit more.

Reviews.Title: “Such a friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: kathmcc
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here at the Ibis, yes it's an Ibis so you really do expect basic but good facilities and cleanliness, but I think this hotel far exceeds this and it's all due to the staff. What a friendly bunch!, from the ladies on reception to the gentlemen in the lovely on site bar/restaurant, the breakfast staff, the porters, the cleaners - they were all very welcoming and friendly and made you feel very comfortable. The breakfast was lovely and fresh with great healthy options and a nice atmosphere to boot!. The rooms are what you would expect, great use of space in the bathrooms, I'm not quite sure how they manage to fit such a large shower in the tiny bathroom, but they did. Great value hotel! The only little issue I would have is with the centralised heating/cooling system . It was too warm for our comfort and the windows only opened a little. However, I would recommend and definitely return. There is a foot/shoulder massage shop a couple of doors down, she does an amazing foot and back massage for 20 euros per 30 minutes. You would normally pay double or treble this in a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel with extremely friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: AdyKiru Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Ibis hotel in Amsterdam is located in waterlooplien. The rooms are decently sized and the hotel is very clean. The staff speak fluent english and are extremely friendly. in fact they can help you on the places to see and also point out with a map where is the place located. There is a Bus stop about 5 minutes walk from the hotel and atram stop about 8 minutes walk, the following things are very close by from the Hotel, Flea market, Super market, heineken in the city, the chill bar....... the centrazl station is about 15 minutes walk from the Hotel, however if you want to take the tram it will teak you the same amount of time. Although the breakfast is the same every day it is very fresh so there are no complaints. I was extremely happy that I booked this hotel and my stay was very comfortable. I will recomend this hotel to friends and will stay here when I visit Amsterdam again...........

Reviews.Title: “HIGHLY RECOMMENDED”
Reviews.Author: Illa_11
Reviews.Content: We would recommend Ibis hotels to any traveller that wants to stay at a reasonable price in a clean, comfortable hotel. The hotel rooms are very neat and tidy, has a coffee station, bathroom and cable TV. The receptionist was very helpful and everyone try to make our stay as comfotable as possible. The only negative - there wasn't enough umbrellas for all rooms, but we had our jackets, and the rain wasn't that bad. Will definitely stay in any Ibis hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Deal”
Reviews.Author: ravenx8
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in this hotel with my wife during a touristic trip to Amsterdam and we loved it, if you take into account the money that we spent on it! Clean rooms, quiet atmosphere, excellent price and good location make this hotel an excellent option to visit Amsterdam. On the back of the hotel you can see a typical water canal and if you stay on the groundfloor you can have a boat just one meter away from your window! For the price I've pais, I can't ask for anything better!

Reviews.Title: “Boa localizaÃ§Ã£o ,apartamento pequeno,preÃ§o salgado”
Reviews.Author: angelaclaudiaC
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights at this hotel. We didn't get a room with a view but ok. Arriving at the hotel was ok and easy. The room was small and the bathroom too. The price was too expensive comparing to the other ibis that i stayed and the others were better. The sheets were old and with a little whole.Neve had seen this at Ibis before. Luggage storage , when i asked the recepcionist who was from arabia or somewherelse told me we are not reponsable for the luggage stored at the hotel we'll open that door automatically and you can put yours there. Was kind of rude but anyway. There's a brazilian recepcionist there who's very polite and helpfull. When i arrived he was very nice and gave me information about the city and the tours i could do. Close to a big and good supermarket and to Rembrandt and jewish museum. In addition there's a bus stop to the sightseeing tours close to the hotel. The tram from central station has a stop close to the hotel. The stay in general was good and the location was fine, in general everything was ok and no frills like ibis concept.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Payonki
Reviews.Content: Good Service was excellent. Breakfast choice very good and plenty of it. Room was clean, modern, comfortable and the bathroom sported a large shower cubicle. Room for two! Location - right on the edge of central Amsterdam Average Food in the restaurant was nothing special. I would advise eating out as there are lots of great places to eat within a 15 minute stroll Common areas such as corridors look "tired". Could do with an update. The power of the shower was disappointing in such a well appointed bathroom

Reviews.Title: “Good choice in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: mh_iulia
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. Ibis hotels basically look similar regardless where you go in Europe. What I can say about this one: it was clean, big bathroom, good breakfast. I was surprised about the variety of choices in the breakfast. Also the restaurant looked really nice. I also liked the position of the hotel. We had a canal view on our room and the hotel was 10 minuted walkind distance from the center of entertainment in Amsterdam. Very convenient. I think you won't be dissapointed if you choose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Everything needed for a stay-here!”
Reviews.Author: MarinaBabitskaya
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel as all Ibises. No surprise and no disappointment! Everything as per standard! Special thank to Maya at reception, she is very helpful, friendly and professional! And all others were perfect at reception, hostess, housekeeper! Thank you to everyone! Location is also nice, 10-15 min away from the city centre, bug not so crowdy and noisy as there. Breakfast is fir 15euro, but it is fine. Taxi service was also perfect and in time. Thank a lot again from Moscow;)

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended. I would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel location was very convenient and the rates were reasonable. Hotel is clean, staff is very friendly and helpful. The hotel was recommended to me by a friend who stayed there before and I would definitely recommend it to friends and will stay there again next time I'm in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “I Would recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Klettenberg
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for two nights in April and decided for Ibis because we were afraid of making a wrong choice, and in Amsterdam it's not so dificult to do so. Well, It's similar to all the other Ibis, it's also big and the staff was very friendly and giving. The breakfast was excelent (for a Ibis...). The only minor issue was theren`t many people walking at the hotel area at night, so I don't know if it's secure and the free internet was only for one hour per day.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for Business Traveller”
Reviews.Author: OmiDhaka
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is good. Its like other budget hotel in Europe. No porter service. Breakfast is good. Room also fine with good bed. Small but organized toilet. Not very near to tourist spot. Nearby cafe at least 7-10 min walk. Big department store 5-7 min walk.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel option in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Our stay in this hotel was a positive surprise after some not so good experiences in other Ibis hotels in France. The employees are really engaged to secure our satisfaction. The cleanliness is very good. The hotel location is pratical for those who need to take the tram or go walking to some of the most important turistical spots. The room is quiet, the bed is good, securing a good sleep. Our suggestion is to change the bathroom soap and shampoo as it smells like hospital soap.

Reviews.Title: “A complete nightmare”
Reviews.Author: laraskydiver
Reviews.Content: Due to a problem with our credit card, we have been treated as beggars at this hotel. We are business people coming from Brazil and had a crazy situation with our international credit card, and even paying all the time for what we eat and for our daily stays, we are on their data bank as PROBLEM GUESTS. We complained about their way of treating us and they said that we don't have anything to complain, as we chose a 3-star hotel. (lol) Sincerely, we've never had such bad experience with staff as we are doing here. Even in the simplest pousadas in Brasil guests are received as if they are unique and if they were staying at a 5-star place.

Reviews.Title: “A bit out of the way”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A bit out of the way - in Amsterdam that means it is not a 2-minute walk but instead a 10-minute walk to the centre. Otherwise perfectly fine hotel; a bit disappointing that Internet access is only free for an hour a day, and then you need to pay. Especially considering that Internet access is basically free at most cafes in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Paula083
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed here for a weekend at the beginning of June with a group of friends to celebrate a birthday. Ideal hotel for the weekend. It was very clean and comfortable and a great base to explore the city. We got the train from the airport to Central Station and easily walked from the station to our hotel with our luggage. This was a pleasant walk which took about 15-20 mins and also allowed us to get our bearings. On arrival he asked which rooms we'd prefer (from the options they had left). Very minimalistic rooms with fantastic 'pod' like bathrooms. We were in the ground floor at the back of the hotel overlooking the canal. Very quiet room away from the main road. Breakfast was included and this was really nice and provided an excellent choice for most tastes. They had a bar and restaurant on-site which we had a few drinks in and a small snack. Very handy to have close by but I always like to venture a bit further out when exploring new places. Would definitely recommend for a weekend break but if you're wanting lots of luxury this woudn't be an ideal choice. Very good though if you want a clean and comfortable base to explore a lovely city.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, nice location.”
Reviews.Author: Alex82
Reviews.Content: Hotel looks nice, is well positioned (15-20 minutes' walk to the city center), staff is friendly, the only drawbacks are the small rooms and the constantly awkward smell in the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: CDM1
Reviews.Content: Wasn't sure what to expect but was pleasantly surprised. Beds very comfortable, rooms clean and tidy and from that side of things very good. Breakfast taken once and wasn't good, poor selection. In fairness I complained and it was taken off the bill but take a walk and there are better options for 15 Euros.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff - Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Will018
Reviews.Content: On our first visit to Amsterdam we stayed at the Ibis for one night before going on a Bike and Barge tour. The airline had lost my luggage and we left the airport hoping the bag would be found soon. The staff at the hotel went out of their way to keep checking on whether the bag had been found. They called the airlines several times, even found a way to track it on the Internet. Although the luggage found its way back to me three days later, after we had left the hotel, their help made the issue a lot less stressful. Besides the great staff, the hotel was a wonderful place to stay. Our room was large and had a nice view of the canal behind the hotel. Everything was clean and looked well maintained. Although our rate did not include breakfast, there was a very nice restaurant off the lobby which offered a good selection of food. The location of the hotel was perfect for us. Amsterdam is a very walkable city, and from here we could reach most any place we wanted to visit. We could easily walk to stores, bakeries, grocery stores. And since we were joining the Bike and Barge tour at the nearby Oosterdok, which was only a five minute walk, no taxi was needed. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A good hotel, in all aspects, except perhaps for one. I frequently stay at IBIS, these are clean, no nonsense hotels, but I find their choice of beds too firm. I would like the option of softer beds.

Reviews.Title: “Stopera is a well located hotel for the budget traveller.”
Reviews.Author: bluecircle
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at the IBIS Stopera Hotel in Amsterdam as part of a three night DFDS package and we found the hotel and its staff were fantastic. It is well located in Amsterdam and although it is not completely centrally located, a travelcard and a 3 minute walk to Mr. Visserplein tram stop puts you within easy access of the rest of Amsterdam. The room was a very good size with very nice and sizeable shower room. The TV was not much to watch for english speakers but it had BBC World if you wanted to keep up. Unfortunately, the Hotel's WiFi was expensive but this did not really detract. The breakfast had a really good range of food and the bar in the evening offered a very nice ice cream dessert. DFDS trippers were well treated with luggage storage and immediate check in at 9 am in the morning (fantastic). The best piece of advice would be that if you are visiting Amsterdam, is to get a tram ticket asap.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: jhermank Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel is good, room is clean & quiet big. Bathroom is a bit small. Location is quiet near to city center by walk, to metro station is near to Waterlooplein station. Staff is very friendly and nice. Free wifi in the room upon request.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it!”
Reviews.Author: Nando_World
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly placed in the Ibis standard. The room is very nice and spacious. The breakfast also is very satisfactory. The reception staff, in particular Ben and Sheron, are very attentive. The hotel location is good. If you walk to the right from the hotel you will achieve the "Dam Square". On the corner of the hotel there is a market as well. There are rooms with a view for the canal that are very nice.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: jaguarlass
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights and the room was clean and tidy. The staff were friendly and helpful. Brekfast was good and evening meal ok but small portions. The hotel is ideally situated and we bought a travel card for the metro, trams and buses. (7 euros a day) which gave us unlimmited travel getting to centre in 5 mins. A must to visit is the flea market just down the road. We are already a return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: YeeLingT
Reviews.Content: We've recently had a 3 night stay at Ibis Amsterdam City Stopera. Staff were friendly and courteous. First thing we were excited about when we entered our room was the canal view through our window. The room overlooks a peaceful canal. The room and toilet were spotless. Room size reasonable for Amsterdam standard. Location was good, as most places were within walking distance. Dam Square was just 10 minutes stroll away, the Red Light district 5 minutes away and a large supermarket 5 minutes away. A tram stop is closeby if you have had enough walking.

Reviews.Title: “don't go to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: b0h0l
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not centrally located and quite a walk from city center. and metro or public transport stop. Surrounding is dirty and not very good and dark at night. Scary to walk at night. Piles of garbage nearby. Room was very hot and had difficulty sleeping because they didn't turn on the airconditioning. I tried to open the window but the noise from the passing cars is horrible. Service was bad. I had dinner at their restaurant and the service was very slow. The food arrived after 30 min waiting. I travel a lot and this is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. I requested for a toothbrush when I arrived in the evening but they could not provide me one! It's understandable not to be provided with a toothbrush in a hostel. But for a hotel? It's unthinkable. So i had to sleep without brushing because stores were already closed. They didn't even offer to give me one in the morning. The bathroom is very small. the towels are very rough. I will never go back to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, wonderful people!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lisstrip
Reviews.Content: Brilliant hotel, stopped here with a group of friends on my hen party. The hotels clean, friendly, breakfast is great and evening food!!! Will defiantly stop here again, good location. Tips - girls don't take heels, only flats. You walk for miles, shopping, sight seeing sandbar crawls. Can't wait go back again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, with all Amsterdam has to offer at your door!”
Reviews.Author: mellyjo23
Reviews.Content: This hotel was what you expect from the IBIS group, basic but very very clean. The staff were also very helpful - they could not do enough for you!! The hotel is a 5 minute walk from Dam Square which is the heart of Amsterdam. Plenty to do in the area. Heineken factory, Anne Frank House and Madame Tussauds all with walking distance. They have themed breakfasts, so this does not guarantee a full English breakfast. There are plenty of street cafes that can offer breakfasts at reasonable cost. I was also able to bring my husbands breakfast to our room when he was feeling a bit under the weather. The bed was very comfortable and mattress firm. Housekeeping were a bit loud in the mornings which is the only negative.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but had a strong smoke smell in the room”
Reviews.Author: tofurker
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ibis Amsterdam City Stopera for one night based on the reviews on TripAdvisor. It was a nice hotel: clean and modern. The rooms are a little small and simple, but fine for a short stay. Our only complaint was that our room smelled like cigarette smoke. We opened the window and thought the smell would clear while we were out for dinner, but when we returned it was still there. This made it very difficult to sleep. Aside from this it was a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, value, staff etcâ€¦”
Reviews.Author: loula_blue
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as it was a reasonable price & we know the Ibis Hotels are a good quality. Once we landed at the airport the train station is just underneath, once we had purchased our tickets and got to the correct platform it took us about 20 minutes to get from Schiphol Airport to Central station in Amsterdam, then it was a short tram or metro trip to the area of the hotel. The hotel is less than a 5 minute walk and first impressions on walking in was how clean & welcoming it was. The reception staff were very friendly and efficient, we arrived at approx 11am and as they had a room available we were able to check in straight away, we were also given a map of the area to help us get around, she even marked where the hotel was to help with our bearings. Our room was lovely, overlooking the canal so great view it was a standard Ibis room so not that big but big enough for us to use as a base & to sleep and again it was very clean. We didn't eat at the hotel as we felt â‚¬15 each for breakfast was too steep but the restaurant area was very well presented and the food did look good. We stayed overall for 3 nights, all the staff from reception, to management, to the cleaners were very polite and friendly, always said hello and from what we gathered they were all able to speak reasonable to really good English. The only thing I missed in the room was that there are no tea/coffee-making facilities in the room but I'm not sure if that is just a British hotel thing? I would highly recommend this hotel for the great location, staff, atmosphere, price etc. p.s. Whilst in Amsterdam make sure you visit the Heineken Experience & go on a Canal tour both are absolutely brilliant and the canal tour will tell you so much about the city you wouldn't otherwise know. The hotel can help making arrangements for both of these.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Ibis hotel - functional and efficient”
Reviews.Author: allanlGlasgowboy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this hotel for 5 nights in March. We had previously stayed in an Ibis hotel in The Hague and the bedroom in this hotel was identical in every respect! Everything works and is of a good three-star hotel standard. The bathroom/shower pod is something you either like or loath but we found it perfectly usable and the shower is excellent. The breakfast at â‚¬15 a time is a bit on the expensive side, in my opinion, but the selection is reasonable for the type of hotel. If you need or wish to have breakfast in the hotel, you would be well advised to book a combined B & B rate, which is better value. We did not have dinner at the hotel and there is not much choice of reastaurants nearby but I can recommend the restaurant Olijfje, which is on the same street as the Ibis (see my separate review). The front desk staff were very helpful and friendly and my previous request for a canal-side room was duly honoured. I would seriously recommend you ask for a canal-side room if at all possible, as the view is very pleasant and, more importantly, it is very quiet. Although the hotel is not centrally located, it is handily placed fo getting to most places of tourist interest. The Central Station is about 15/20 minutes walk and you can get access to the tram system at the top of Valkenburgerstraat, about 5 minutes walk. The only drawbacks we found were that there are no tea/coffee-making facilities in the room, though this seems commonplace in mainland Europe. Also, the bedroom floors were not carpetted, so you could hear other guests walking about in their rooms. This was an occasional nuisance at night.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and good views ... if you get the right room”
Reviews.Author: HernanCortez
Reviews.Content: I often stay in IBIS hotels, so this is written from the perspective of someone who likes their functionality, rooms etc. IBIS Stopera was the usual well-run IBIS that I like. Normally I stay in the IBIS next to the train station when I'm in Amsterdam for a short time. It's really handy. This last trip, I stayed at the IBIS Stopera. At first I thought the location would be a problem, however I was wrong. I had a couple of days off work and it's a great location for visiting Amsterdam. Just near Wasserplein metro and Rembrandt Square / New Market. There's also bike hire shop just down the road. I stayed in room on the 5th or 6th floor and had a view over a canal and the roof tops / church spires of Amsterdam. It was a very nice view and definitely added to my positive impression of the hotel. Next time I go to Amsterdam, if I am there for any longer than one night, I'll stay at the Stopera again

Reviews.Title: “very clean,very quiet,very good position,super desk staf”
Reviews.Author: Tudor_10
Reviews.Content: First of all very friendly and helpful desk staff,we got a room earlier:at 10am instead 2pm,wich was super nice from them after 5 hours on airplane,they gave us one canal view room if we asked for,wich was fab.hotel it's near to tram&metro stations,near to one small supermarket,near to most main amsterdam'`s atractions.Clean,quiet.Breakfast very various,but unchanged 4 days (absolute the same),but with many choices,free coffe,thea,milk;in one word:very good breakfast.even if we got free wifi-2 hours/day,could be better to be free wifi all day long as other hotels offer.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need”
Reviews.Author: pollypocket1
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 day stay in Amsterdam at the Stopera and had a fantastic time. The hotel, although certainly not extravagant, provided us with everything we needed for a comfortable and enjoyable stay. The Ibis was clean, staff were friendly, breakfast was excellent (which came free with the room) and the location couldn't have been better. I would advise people to stay here as being that little bit out of the centre means you end up seeing so much more of this incredible city.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: System38
Reviews.Content: A good city centre location makes the Stopera a good base from which to explore Amsterdam. I can pretty much confirm everything positive that has been wriiten before. Approx 15-20 min stroll from Centraal Station should mean no need for a taxi, although not in the middle of things most sights are only a short walk away. Good check-in experience and a ground floor canal view room are the only things I can comment on really, both of which were good. The room was clean and spacious for one person with a good en-suite bathroom and nice view over the canal to the rear of the hotel. A good advance internet price meant overall good value for money. Having stayed at a variety of hotels in Amsterdam I can recommend and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: heodeza
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel not far from the center. Nice modern bathroom, clean place, great breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Ibis Amsterdam City Stopera”
Reviews.Author: sanguinaddiction
Reviews.Content: Very clean, friendly helpfull staff, excellent restaurant, amazing free continental breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Charalambosh
Reviews.Content: For what you pay i didn't expect more. Very good if your only planning to sleep and shower there. Could do with finding what makes every toilet in the hotel have a sewage smell. Even though the whole builiding was warm it would have been better if the room air conditions worked. Overall good.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, restuarant lefted me puzzled??”
Reviews.Author: anichleirigh
Reviews.Content: My bofriend and I stayed here for an October break, perfect location, close-by to the city centre. We often lefted early in the morining and explored Amsterdam, upon returning we ate in the restuarant located on the ground floor. The menu never changed, there was no special evening meals of Chef's special's that was a little disappointing. The closing time of the restuarant was very unpredicable, service was very slow and sometime the waiter had to return to reask us our order. Maybe they should have hired more staff on the occassion that they knew were there busier times. Otherwise the bedroom was fine, a little small but fine. We will return to Amsterdam but maybe not here to the Ibis City Stopera.

Reviews.Title: “Close by, Clean good sleep and good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Westenc
Reviews.Content: Just a good basic hotel. Very good location. Very good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Room 213”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel four times and have never had any complaints until now. The bathroom smelled like it had plumbing problem. There was an unpleasent smell coming from the bathroom into the bedroom.

Reviews.Title: “Our various stays at the Stopera”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I first stayed at the hotel with a colleague on two occasions in April 2008, where we were made welcome at check in and also at the bar, which has a very comfortable relaxed atmosphere. Members of staff we have dealt with have been most friendly and helpful. When standing at reception you overhear how some of the difficult situations that clients have are dealt with by the reception staff in a friendly professional manner. Over the last fifteen years I have stayed at most of the Ibis Hotels in France, Germany, Austria, Switzerland, Czech Republic, Slovakia and the UK and I would think that the ratio of people staying at the hotel and eating in the restaurant is amongst the highest I have seen. The breakfast is of a very high quality and includes both hot and cold food. Some Ibis Hotels do have a lot of people eating in the restaurant but they move on after they have eaten and a lot of bars at Ibis hotels are often deserted. I have stayed at the hotel with my wife on several occasions and at one time saw there were around forty people from several nationalities in the restaurant, eating, drinking and looking very relaxed, at ease and in no rush to go anywhere else. In the past when the hotel was full we stayed somewhere else but in the evening we went to the Stopera to have our evening meal and a drink. The hotel has the air of a well run family hotel where people are made to feel at home and happy to spend time for a meal and a drink. The restaurant now has an Italian theme which again proves relaxing and the food is good and reasonably priced. We recently went to Germany via Amsterdam both ways; we were again made welcome at reception, followed by a meal in the restaurant which again was very good. . Some guests had experienced difficult journeys due to the weather conditions but everyone was well looked after by the staff in the bar / restaurant in a friendly manner. While in Germany we stayed two nights at a Mercure Hotel which in my opinion was not half as good as the Stopera .

Reviews.Title: “Good times”
Reviews.Author: Cmb1978
Reviews.Content: Me and a friend moved to this hotel after the one we booked was horrible and were very impressed, good value, clean, warm, comfy beds a working telly and a good shower room. Really good value for money. Will stay again

Reviews.Title: “We would definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Stu89
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in a good location to most of Amsterdam. After having an early flight we were pleased that we could check into our room at 10am. The room was perfectly clean and had everything we needed. The reception staff were very helpful and breakfast had a good variety of food with decent milk! I'm sure we will visit this beautiful city again and will most definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Angellore78 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: On arriving the staff were very friendly and polite. We were given a double room on the top floor facing the canal. The view was lovely. The bed was very comfortable and we had excellent nights sleeps. The room was very quiet. For Amsterdam it was a good size. The bathroom had a shower, no bath, but the shower was very powerfull and easy to use. The hotel is located in the Waterlooplein area. For the price we paid we were very impressed, as in Amsterdam you can pay a lot more and get a lot less. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “was very good-much more than expected.”
Reviews.Author: becca1709
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were brilliant throughout our stay. they were all friendly and very helpful. all the rooms we saw in the hotel were immaculate. it is in easy walking distance of all the major tourist spots. we would definitely go back to this hotel if we were to return to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel not too far from everything”
Reviews.Author: lunasbear
Reviews.Content: We had a couple of nights at the Ibis Stopera. It's located about 15 minutes walk from the main train station and everything else in downtown Amsterdam. We were able to check into our room at 11 a.m. .The rooms are non special, with small tv and decent bathrooms, but clean. Had a room towards the courtyard which was rather quiet as well. The Hotel offers a small amount of parking spaces for 35 Euros/per day and breakfast for a fee in their own restaurant. Around the corner from the Hotel is a grocery store as well as an excellent Bagel shop for needs as well.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient economy / business hotel”
Reviews.Author: one_carry-on_max
Reviews.Content: This is a economy hotel, similar to other Ibis locations. We stayed here in Nov 2010 for 3 nights. Room was very clean, spacious (by European standards), with a canal view. (Not all rooms have this view, so you might request it.) There is a restaurant in the lobby serving breakfast and dinner (did not use). Wireless internet was fast, 4 Euro for 24 hours. A coin-operated PC in the lobby allows you to check in and print airline boarding passes. The hotel is closest to the Jewish museum and Amsterdam Heritage museum, and within walking or tram distance of other sites including the historic canals. The specific neighborhood for the hotel is less scenic, but perfectly fine. With the exception of one night, when another guest started singing in the middle of the night, all was quiet. Room heater was only partially effective in keeping out the chill. Still, I would recommend it overall considering the cleanliness, space, and price.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location in the centre of Amsterdam. Affordable, simple but typical Ibis rooms”
Reviews.Author: daveh104
Reviews.Content: The hotel isnt smack bang in the centre of Amsterdam but close. The location is fairly quiet with little of interest on the street it slocated on but a short walk brings you to the action, restaurants and bars etc. Our room was at the back looking over the canal which was perfect. The room appeared to be recently decorated / furnished and offered everythigng you might expect from a fairly cheap hotel room such as a TV and hanging space. The bathroom seemed to be a purpose built pod, a bit plasticy and small, but it was clean and had a good shower. Reception staff were friendly and attentive. We did not use the bar or restaurant so can not comment. I would return to this hotel and would recommend to anyone travellign to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, quiet and spotlessly clean”
Reviews.Author: maggieandreggie
Reviews.Content: Arriving early from our DFDS crossing our room was still ready for us at 11am. Bed super comfy, room was warm and well presented, with a canal view (5th floor). Plenty of space in bathroom, everything spotlessly clean. A reasonable 10-15 min walk to the main centre, pubs, restaurants etc but also a few places to eat and drink nearer the hotel. Could easily have stayed another night or two. The inclusive breakfast was more than adequate with a good selection of hot and cold food and lovely frehly-baked bread.Staff friendly and helpful. Luggage storage area is available. One tiny- teeny gripe, no tea/coffee making stuff in room. Great stay !

Reviews.Title: “good vaule hotel in centre of amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: JSCSFife
Reviews.Content: great hotel within 10 min walk from central train station 5 min walk to dam square so very good location without city centre rip off prices if you book in advance you should get a good rate, hotel tick all requirements for a lovely visit to amsterdam. john & shona fife scotland

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Quick In Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: LXSEN
Reviews.Content: I was originally booked into the Ibis at the train station, but due to an error of my part I arrived to late to confirm the room, so I was relocated to this Ibis just 20 mins. by foot from the station. Fortunately the staff was helpful but I did end up paying the maximum fare of 149 Euro per night. The hotel itself is good, renovated Ibis with an interesting shower/bath room type. Solid, quick and clean and not expensive, yet I do prefer the Ibis at Amsterdam Centraal.

Reviews.Title: “Great affordable clean rooms and good service”
Reviews.Author: Stoffer23
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is great and is located a short walk from the city centre. Everything is within walking distance if you're up to it. Don't expect a lot from the close evirontment of the hotel, as it's not that interesting and has nothing going on, but there's a supermarket close by and a good bike rental business. We spent three nights at Ibis Stopera and were very satisfied. We wanted a place to stay that was nice, clean, affordable and central location and got it. We booked three nights over the weekend and recieved a 30% discount. The staff is real friendly, we asked to move room from the front of the hotel to the backside where there's a canalview and got it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, very friendly staff, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: TranceBR
Reviews.Content: Great location, walking distance (even when it's cold) to the Rembrandtplein where some pubs, clubs and restaurants are located. Very friendly staff, always willing to help. The city center is small, you can walk to wherever you want, or rent a bike. There's a one-hour free internet voucher per day (for use in the lobby?). Great pasta restaurant. Just watch out for the taxi charges. We took the taxi on Amsterdam Centraa and the security guy told us it would be no more than EUR 10.00, we also checked that on the sign on the taxi stop, but the coach charged us EUR 15.00 for a less than 5 minutes ride. According to other reviews it seems this is pretty common in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, pleasant staff.”
Reviews.Author: Mim74
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as part of a cruise and stay package with DFDS. I was worried that Ibis would be too basic but was pleasantly surprised. We had a twin room that was spacious with a nice big shower and a great view over one of the canals,the bar was nice and the breakfast was good.The staff were friendly and helpful but the best thing was the location, we walked everywhere and didn't need to use public transport, it wasn't right in the middle of things though so was nice and quiet! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: maremar
Reviews.Content: The hotel is near the center, no need public transportation to many places of interest. The room and bathrrom are big enough, both clean, there's a great plasma tv, and we sleeped very well because it was quiet.

Reviews.Title: “simple, modern and functional”
Reviews.Author: Athena1974
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our four-night-stay in Amsterdam in Ibis Amsterdam Stopera. Some friends had suggested Ibis to me since I was looking for a clean and bargain hotel. After several weeks search I realized that I couldn't find a three star with the services Ibis offers and the same price. I reserved a double room. A few days later I found I had skipped the special offer option which cuts down on prices to a great degree, and includes breakfast as well, but it was too late. When I got to the hotel I realized I had made the right choice: The hotel building was new and modern, the rooms perfectly clean, the receptionists very-well trained and helpful, and most of all, the location was great; close to Amsterdam main attractions while having a quiet and peaceful neighborhood. There are only two negative points about the hotel: One is the small size of the rooms;even so, they're designed in the most functional way. The second, I believe, is that the small size of rooms can be tolerated only if you stay in the rooms with the beautiful canal view. My first room had the view of the back of some buildings which intensified the sense of suffocation I had because of the small space, but fortunately I could change it to a room with canal view the second day and that really made a difference.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a great hotel for an Amsterdam visit...”
Reviews.Author: CraigandKeely
Reviews.Content: After arriving at the airport, which is huge, we caught the train into Amsterdam Central Station which cost 3.70 euro and took around 20 minutes, the ticket machines were very easy to use, and helpful that you can select a language. (Note the machines we saw were either card only or card and coins - i didnt notice any machines that took notes) a ticket office is available if the machines seem a little daunting! On arriving at Central Station, the hotel is an approximate 15 minute walk away, and is very easy to locate. The location of the hotel itself is on a fairly busy road, and is in the old Jewish quarter about 100m away from Waterlooplein, and the flea market. There is a Metro station around the corner, but we never used it as we walked everywhere in the city, a supermarket is also located nearby which was useful as there are no tea/coffee facilities in the room. All attractions are pretty much nearby aswell, with a 10-15 minute walk taking you to most attractions including Dam square, red light district etc etc. We arrived at the hotel just before 10am, there were not any rooms ready but the lady on reception kindly told us one would be available at 12 noon and offered to look after our bags in a secure room/locker. The room itself was on the third floor, and was a good size, modern, with an lcd tv on the wall. The bathroom, again, was a good size, with a large shower and hair dryer attached to the wall, both rooms were very clean and to be honest, spotless. Our towels were changed daily, and the bed made everyday. We stayed for 3 nights and had breakfast each morning which was great, it was a buffet style, which had everything from coffee and juice, to fruit, to hot food, pasteries, bread, yoghurt etc etc... all was very nice, and was replenished often, great for filling up before a day exploring!
