The breakfast room doubles as the restaurant later on in the day, we never actually ate there later on, so i cant comment on the food in the evening. During our stay we experienced no problems whatsoever , all the staff we encountered were friendly and helpful, they all acknowledged us as we passed. I would definately recommend this hotel for a visit to Amsterdam. One final tip would be to book your tickets for Anne Frank House onine, you just print your tickets out at home, (take them with you of course) and you can just walk right past the extremely long queue, that snakes round the corner and walk through a door on the left and straight in! It cost an extra 50 cent, but meant not having to queue for 2hours!

Reviews.Title: “Good place in expensive City”
Reviews.Author: prozerran
Reviews.Content: 2nights in August 2010 Amsterdam is an expensive city. This hotel was prebooked months in advance and it was around 90Euro a night. Location â€“ good 15min walk from Central train station along the river. 5-10min walk to the central square and shopping region. Metro/tram stops nearby, but everything is accessible by a short 10-15min walk. Huge shower cubicle. Breakfast not included, supermarket within 5 minutes, restaurants 5-10mins to have a meal. No minibar or tea/coffee facilities. Our room was next to the elevator - but surprisingly quiet and no problems. A good hotel for touristy Amsterdam. A little further to walk but does the job.

Reviews.Title: “Not very fancy but clean and nice”
Reviews.Author: Imagecatcher
Reviews.Content: Friends booked this as part of a car ferry trip from Newcastle, England. One night at the Ibis and a canal cruise were part of the package. We were much happier with the hotel than the canal cruise. I don't know what we paid for the room since it was part of the package but it was clean and comfortable and not badly located.

Reviews.Title: “not bad”
Reviews.Author: lookie
Reviews.Content: Hi Good points- close to central station. about a 15 minute walk. We were charged 25 Euros in a taxi which we now know was a clear rip off. Hotel is only a 10 minute walk to Dam Square and also the Red Light district. Reception/ Bar staff were friendly Bad points- in a run down block, no fridge or tea/coffee facilities. Never tried any meals as were expensive Room was clean but small & basic, no seats for instance. Amsterdam- nice city to walk around if its Sunny, which it was for us. Enjoyed Anne Frank House & Heineken experience. Can be expensive for drinks, overall enjoyed our 3 day break

Reviews.Title: “Great location - no public transportation needed”
Reviews.Author: LuanaOnVacation
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a weekend. Very good value for money. Very close to the city center, train station etc. We walked with our suitcases from the train station to the hotel in about 15 min. The train ticket from Schiphol airport to the main train station costs 3.70 euros one way - very cheap. We didn't try the breakfast at the hotel. There was a big supermarket very close by. The room was very nice and clean and looked exactly like on the pictures shown on the Ibis website. The staff was very nice and polite - always. We stored our luggage at the hotel after check-out because our flight departed in the evening. There's a metro station very close to the hotel but we neither used public transportation nor taxis as we could walk everywhere we wanted to go. Even at night it was no problem walking back to the hotel. Very nice hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Close to Schiphol airport if you need to overnight”
Reviews.Author: WandaVictoriaBC
Reviews.Content: Choose after flight delay, okay hotel, would have been better to go to Ibis downtown since we saw one went we took the train downtown to walk around. Very very small room- did not look the photo we saw at the airport, guess it shrunk while we were on the airporter. Twin beds right beside each other- no space in between.

Reviews.Title: “Clea and central”
Reviews.Author: Billymcd
Reviews.Content: We had decided that when we got off the train at central station we would get a taxi to ibis stopera.Mistake nummber 1 was not asking how much the fare would be.The journey took 2 minutes,less than 1 mile travelled and he asked for 25euros i gave him 30 as i did not have 25 exactly i asked for the 5 change and the cheeky b...... said 5 euro tax.and kept the 30 euros at which i swore at him.Welcome to amsterdam..walked from hotel to central station and it took between 15 to 20 minutes.The hotel itself was very clean and is more central than i thought.Turn right from hotel and right again and shops and restuarants start from there right to dam square.Other reviews said the rooms were small but i did not find that to be the case tv and hair dryer in room but no tea or coffee can be made as no kettle in room.We were room only so can't comment on breakfast.stayed 2 nights and the city tax on room was 9.80 euros per room

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient, close to all the tourist hot spots.”
Reviews.Author: aliakapoor
Reviews.Content: We asked for a top floor canal facing room and we got it. Request for one as the view makes the room feel bigger and nicer. Standard Ibis comfort and quality, so you know what to expect. Bed was very comfortable but the bathroom is quite small. Very good service and the breakfast was good too (included in our room rate)... eat the rode bes jam at breakfast, its the best jam in the world!!! close to an albert heijn if you need groceries and cute cafes a short distance away (5 min walk). took us about 15 min to walk to dam square, red light district etc... about 1/2 hour walk to anne frank house - about 10-15 min walk to central station but with our suitcases we took a cab and it was about 8 euro to the hotel. we were in amsterdam for 4 days and 2 nights were at the ibis. would def stay there again unless we wanted to stay near the museum quarter (the NH museum quarter was where we stayed for the other 2 nights - written a review about this too). the ibis is in a quiet area but not very pretty, however, a short walk will take you to all the cute cafes and bakery places... alia & chetan - new zealand.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with hotel choice.”
Reviews.Author: 1lolly1
Reviews.Content: Myself and two friends stayed in this Ibis for two nights in a triple room. We were checked in swiftly by two very pleasant gentlemen. Our rooms were not ready as it was only 10am but they offered to take care of our bags and assured us that our room would be ready by twelve. When we came back, our room was ready and we were delighted to discover it had a view of the water. The room was small but acceptable for three people with large suitcases. The bathroom was small but spotless. The shower was fantastic, nice and spacious and good power. Breakfast on both mornings was really good. There was a great variety to choose from and it was really tasty. The gentleman who worked in the restaurant at breakfast time had a pleasant smile and 'good morning' each morning. Check out was hassle free and they also called us a taxi to bring us to the train station. Overall I would definitely stay at this hotel again and recommend it to anyone as it presents excellent value for money. I was also extremely impressed with the staff who were friendly, professional and helpful. Thanks for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Basic, but very good”
Reviews.Author: JanBerlin
Reviews.Content: A typical no-frills Ibis hotel with its cruise ship economy cabin style rooms (our quiet room even had water views), good breakfast and comfortable beds. Location was near the Amsterdam opera and close to Waterlooplein (subway). (Slow) wifi was 3.95 EUR per day. Given the relatively low price (for Amsterdam standards) you can hardly ask for more.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel at reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Eledem
Reviews.Content: It is very well situated, 3 minutes walk to the nearest tram station, 10 minutes walk to the Red Light District and 15 minutes walk to the city centre. Very good quality and variety of breakfast. The room and bathroom are very spacious and completely renovated. The staff is friendly and multi-lingual. The hotel is very clean and the accommodation is at very reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel If You're Looking For Reasonable Room Rates”
Reviews.Author: cahayapagi
Reviews.Content: Overall, our 2 nights stay were good. At first I was a bit uncomfortable with the idea of 3 stars hotel but since we were looking for reasonable room rates (EUR119.00 p/night), we booked immediately at the airport (Schipol). The staff was very friendly & helpful. She didn't pressure us to take 2 nights stay but rather asked us to try 1 night first. So we did. She also gave us a printed direction how to get to the hotel via public transport from the airport. The hotel location is very convenient, easy access to public transport, nearby supermarket, shops, motorbike or bicycle rental shop, etc. We rented a motorbike from the shop & the guy was very helpful. It was a good thing to do as we got around comfortably & saw pretty much everything. In the end, we decided to stay for another night in the hotel, as it was so convenient for us. The room size was decent & so did the bathroom. The staffs were helpful & friendly. Of course, nothing luxurious about the hotel but enough to furnish your basic needs while traveling.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent room with a view”
Reviews.Author: TooMuchofTooLittle
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as wanted a reasonably priced hotel in town center, for our two night visit to Amsterdam. We chose this for the first night and then moved to another aiport hotel (IBIS again) for the next. The hotel was easy to reach from the train station, with a short hop on the bus (I would advise that you take the day-pass for the bus - very handy). The hotel was a five minute walk from the bus-stand, and a 10 from the nearest metro, so a bus ride is advised. The locality is okay, with a flea market at a walking distance and a big supermarket at two minutes walk - prefer to shop there than the overpriced vending machines in the hotel compund. The famous Dam Square is a good 10-15 minutes walk, but the view is good so the walk is comfortable. The rooms themselves are confortable - not too large, but enough to keep your basic luggage. The room we got was very nice - it directly overlooked the canal, and the view was beautiful - reminded us of Venice! With an LCD TV in the room and a large closet, the room was one of the better ones I have seen at IBIS hotels. With a (comaparatively) large bath area, the toilet was clean and adequate. The staff at the hotel was courteous, and helped out with some hot water from the cafe which I needed for my soar throat. While the water in the taps is potable, I would not advise risking it and suggest bottled water there. Overall, a good value for money and a nice, clean hotel for all age-groups and families. Would recommmend this for the next visit. Directions: By train: From the Central Train Station, take the metro two stops to Waterlooplein. Alternatively, and preferably, take the bus to Waterloopein that's much faster and lesser walking.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean & centrally located”
Reviews.Author: CraigWright
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner stopped here for two nights after taking DFDS up on their offer of a city break and ferry crossing. The hotel is very well located being quite close to all the usual tourist hotspots and when we arrived on a Sunday morning very close to quite a large outside market. Our double room was quite roomy and with what seemed quite a new bathroom suite (albeit only a shower). Breakfast was very nice and certainly set you up for the day. Reception staff very approachable and helpful with directions and other touristy advice. That nice we are stopping again very soon. PS if you do nothing else in Amsterdam you have to try Cassa Rossa!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Starrynight2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for one night and wished web could have stayed longer. The service was fantastic, we were ably to get into our room early leaving the rest of the day for sightseeing. The room was very comfortable and the breakfast was great- too much to choose from. The hotel was fairly centrally situated with the town centerand railway station a comfortable walk even with bags in tow. A tram stop was also just down the road. I would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: JohnMike
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean and good value for money, breakfasts were included in the price which we were not expecting. Great location for easy access to the centre of Amsterdam. Staff were helpful if we needed directions or assistance with anything. Would certainly use this hotel again. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, comfortable well run hotel minutes from city centre”
Reviews.Author: GordonBloch
Reviews.Content: On arrival at the hotel we were checked in by an extremely helpful receptionist. In no time she had our booking, and as per our request were given a top floor, rear facing room, overlooking a quiet canal. Exactly what we wanted. Room was a comfortable size,clean and modern, with unique shaped bathroom, and large shower cubicle. The hotel is situated about a 7 minute walk from the city center, with ample shops and restaurants,and about 10 mins walk from the pier, from where we were to board our cruise.There is a large supermarket about 2 mins walk from the hotel. Room rate included hot buffet breakfast, including eggs, meats breads, juices,cakes and more. This was ample to see us through most of the day Hotel staff were always ready to assist and answer tourist questions, or give advice. The hotel is situated near the Portuguese Synagogue, close proximity to the local flea market. Additionally, the hotel offered to hold our baggage when we returned from our cruise at no cost. Bottom line; modern, comfortable polite hotel in good situation.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate, but somehow lacking in hospitality.”
Reviews.Author: MustRoll
Reviews.Content: Very small rooms, with strange step-up, prefab bathrooom. Handicap bathroom designed by someone unfamiliar with being handicapped. Shower very hard to use and control. One grab bar placed in wrong location, no other grab bars for shower or sink area. Mirror impossible to see in from sitting position. No counter space. Staff responded to requests, but smiles were rare. Hotel is in a good location for seeing most of the city. Cost was high compared to what we paid at an NH near Museums two years ago.

Reviews.Title: “Ibis - No frills done well.”
Reviews.Author: minibreak_hero
Reviews.Content: I Stayed with 4 friends in Amsterdam for my Hen weekend so we wanted somewhere reasonably priced and centrally located. We selected the City Stopera rather than the Ibis central station after reading reviews on trip advisor about the noise. OK-we're hens, but we want a good nights sleep! We were extremely impressed by the Ibis. I've stayed in Ibis hotels before so am aquainted with their no-nonsense funtionality but they seemed to have taken the quality up a notch. Rooms had a flat screen TV and were tidy and clean. The bed was comfy and the duvet fluffy. Curtains blacked out every ounce of light-perfect for lying in after a hard nights partying. The hotel was quiet and we weren't frequently woken up by late night door-slamming and talking in the corridors which can be true of other town centre budget hotels. The shower cubicle was roomy and was almost like a wet room and the shower was powerful with plenty of hot water. I thought the hairdryer wasn't powerful enough and was wired into the bathroom which wasn't convenient as I wanted to dry my hair while my friend was in the shower. I was glad I brought my own. Shower gel and a shower cap were provided and was impressed to see Ibis using eco-friendly shower gel. Towels looked new and were fluffy and soft. Staff were friendly and helpful. They allowed us to check in early. During late afternoon we sat in the hotel bar for a couple of small lagers to chill out and bar staff brought us brushetta to try with meat on them. When 3 of us explained that we were vegetarian, they made special meat free ones for us, which we felt was a nice touch. Hotel reception ordered a taxi for us to go out of a night who was reasonably priced and helpful. The bar is tastefully decorated and had a nice atmosphere. Tables were decorated with candles and flowers and had a buzz that a hotel bar doesn't usually have. A word of warning it was extremely expensive (11 euros for a brandy and diet coke! ). The Hotel was conveniently located near Waterlooplein and we were able to get metro/trams and buses. We didn't try the breakfast as we found an excellent bagel shop round the corner called Tony's where you could get a bagel and a coffee for about 7 euro and tasty! Hotel check out was 12 and we appreciated the extra hour in bed as we thought, like most hotels we would have to check out by 11. All 5 of us were in agreement that we would stay at the hotel again for future visits to this brilliant city. I'm sure it won't be half as fun as my Hen weekend though!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable and in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Tillard
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a clean and comfortable hotel in a quiet area yet within easy walking distance of the centre of Amsterdam then this hotel is ideal. The rooms are of a reasonable size and although the bathroom is a little on the small side it is nevertheless perfectly functional. The rooms were immaculately kept and the staff friendly and helpful. The breakfast was particularly good with a wide choice of hot and cold food available. All decent hotels in large cities tend to be expensive but the Ibis Stopera was quite reasonable in comparison to similar hotels in Amsterdam. Two small points which have been mentioned by other travellers :- 1. Be aware that there is no tea/coffee machine in the rooms so consider bringing your own travel kettle 2. Ask for a room with a canal view if possible - quieter and more picturesque. Overall, this hotel is a good choice and recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent option”
Reviews.Author: r88my
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent option in Amsterdam. Rooms are spacious and clean. Bathrooms are modern and clean. No outside noise even though facing the main road. Stones throw from tram stop and a leisurely 10 minute walk to the centre of amsterdam. Area was safe at all times of day and night. Supermarket nearby. Price of rooms is so cheap when going through accor website, and staff allowed us to check in early. Thoroughly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireJames
Reviews.Content: great location . breakfast great loads of choice. bar a little expensive but so is Amsterdam. although hope to return soon, definitely will stay at the Ibis. room really clean nice fresh towels each day. staff pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Ibis service”
Reviews.Author: johnandjulie
Reviews.Content: We arrived 1000 on New Years Eve and luckily our room was ready.The room had recently been refurbished with wooden flooring and a plush widescreen TV fixed on the wall so it was easy to watch whilst in bed.This hotels location is about 20 minutes walk to Dam Square passing through the Red Light District . Our breakfast was included,however,if I had to pay 15 Euros I would have felt cheated. Amsterdam is a wonderful place and despite the 120 Euro a night cost of a room at this hotel you could do a lot worse. The price of drinks are outrageous bit I guess the Pound against the Euro does not help .Small beer 4 Euros and small glass of wine 3.5 Euros All in all a good but expensive 3 nights in Amsterdam .

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel, just off the city center”
Reviews.Author: georgeadams
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a modern, relatively new building, which is nice. If you see the old, narrow buildings that accommodate most hotels in the city center in Amsterdam, you will agree that it is a blessing that this hotel is a bit off of it. It is not very far though. It's a 15-20 minutes walk from the hotel to the Dam Square. It is however relatively near (5mins) to the Tram & Metro Station of Waterlooplein. Therefore, the distance from the city center was not a real problem for us. Our room was not very large but it was just fine. Everything inside it was in *excellent* condition (bathrooom/shower/bed/tv etc). The bed was very comfortable. We asked and were given a room with a view to the canal which was nice and quiet. Breakfast is not always included in the room price, so check it when you book the room. The breakfast boufet was satisfactory.

Reviews.Title: “Far from the madding crowd”
Reviews.Author: RossiterSpain
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights. My husband was at the RAI for a trade show so I was left to my own devices during the day and found the hotel too far from the centre for walking. The room was adequate with its strange pod bathroom with little space to put anything - but I find that in most hotel bathrooms. The extractor fan didn't work all the time we were there despite reporting it and their assurances that it would be fixed. Management offered us a complimentary drink in the bar on our last night to compensate us but we didn't accept. We had a quiet room overlooking the canal where I could watch the swans and ducks. Very restful. We dined twice in the restaurant which was okay. Take your own Kleenex. Take your own pillow (theirs are rock hard). Staff are charming and very helpful when asked.

Reviews.Title: “I liked it”
Reviews.Author: HristinaM
Reviews.Content: We were 2 couples and stayed there in the early November. Really small room but I knew that and I was prepared for it. It was clean and nice, I liked the bathroom. It was a little noisy though in the morning because of the chambermaid who was like a whirlwind with the vacuum-cleaner and all other cleaning accessories. We came to the conclusion that the walls are probably thin. Location: excellent, not in the central center but in a walking distance from everything you would like to see in Amsterdam. The neighborhood seemed to be quite place.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, not the greatest location”
Reviews.Author: The-Piking-Pirate
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Ibis hotels all over Europe, I like this chain as they are above average and you always know what you are going to get. This Ibis is good value for money but the location could be better, I would recommend staying at the one by Central Station instead.

Reviews.Title: “Rating”
Reviews.Author: LouisK1
Reviews.Content: Very Good and friendly service, internet can be a problem

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, would recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: pinnyboots
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers a comfortable option for people who don't want to spend their entire trip to Amsterdam in the hotel room. I recently took a trip there with family, and this Ibis was a really good choice for us. We were up and out of the hotel by 9:00 each morning and only returned at the end of a long day to sleep! Rooms were as expected- small, functional and clean. Staff were friendly and helpful. I can't comment on the food there, as we ate out every day. If you don't want to pay for breakfast there ( I think it's â‚¬15 or thereabouts), Tony's NY city bagels is only 5 minutes walk from the hotel on Jodenbreestraat 15 is a really good value alternative.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: 3LittleFonzys
Reviews.Content: Stayed from friday to monday at the hotel for the marathon - room included breakfast. Had a nice view looking over the canal. Staff were very helpful and always available for questions at all times. Room was very clean and standard ibis style with the funny bathroom. Very happy with the room and the hotel. The only slight negative is with the noise coming from other rooms. if you a light sleeper this may cause a problem as with the doors closing and other noises it can be a bit unsettling. Breakfast was a nice buffet, lots of selection and pleased it was included in the room price. location wise, its fine, maybe 20 mins from central station, we wanted to rest our legs for the marathon so took the tram and metro quite a lot - all very convienent. Definitely would stay there again and would be happy to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: Stelu
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel, about 15 min walk from the center, very clean, friendly staff. The room was small but comfortable, the bath small as well but very well organised. Half of the rooms have a view over a canal (so make sure to ask for one of these rooms). The only downside seems to be the price of the breakfast (15 euro/person); and maybe the fact that you can only have sandwiches for lunch at the hotel restaurant. Also, the towels had a funny smell. Bur, all in all, a lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: laetitiaGermany
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is well-located, few steps from Rembrandtplein, a square which is very agreable at night and day. The staff was very gentle, the rooms were clean and large to the categorie, we enjoyed a lot our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, functional - pleasant place to spend a night or two”
Reviews.Author: MaKSiNG
Reviews.Content: Service: Pleasant and professional. Room: Clean, basic, functional. Relatively modern. Totally acceptable standard with flat screen TV. Average size. Bathroom: Clean, basic, functional. Shower enclosure, no bath. Location: Just outside the very center. 10 minute walk to center. Right on larger road for easy access by car. Additional: This is the 2nd time I have stayed at this hotel and can therefore say I would recommend it. We paid around â‚¬90 for a double room for dual occupancy. I considered this acceptable for the standard and in relation to the average price in Amsterdam. Parking is in an attended, covered, garage a couple of doors down from the hotel reception, so very well located. But beware the price was â‚¬32 for 24 hours. I am led to believe though, this is still one of the cheapest in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great for short city break”
Reviews.Author: Firedancer87
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed there for 2 nights as we went to Amsterdam from England to see Dave Matthews Band at Heineken Music Hall. We had a room at the first floor with an amazing view of the canal. The room was small but very clean and comfortable. Location just great for our needs - close to historical centre of Amsterdam as well as to main station. The only thing that really really annoyed us during our stay at Amsterdam City Stopera was a very loud cleaner banging on our door early in the morning while we were still asleep and then making a lot of noise in the corridor. The rest of the staff was very friendly and helpful. Definitely a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: hifh_rock
Reviews.Content: Despite not being situated in the historical centre of Amsterdam, there are few faults with this three star Ibis hotel. Rooms are clean and bathrooms functional, featuring a shower, and many have views over one of the city's canals. Air conditioning is also installed and rooms to the rear of the building are exceptionally quiet. The standard of service is very good and the hotel additionally features a reasonably priced cafe/bar. Overall, the Ibis Stopera is a good choice for anyone visiting Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent”
Reviews.Author: handbagsandgladrags
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was lovely modern and well laid out, we stayed in a room at the back which over looked a canal and a residential area so the room was very quiet. Only complaint was a dusty window sill and no welcome tea or biscuits. The staff were friendly and helpful even after we checked out and were sitting on the bars terrace waiting for our bus there was no pressure to buy drinks or move on. There was a wide choice for breakfast up-to 11am. We arrived in the middle of a heat wave and there was a complimentary water cooler in reception For people like me who don't like to much heat. We would definitely use again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice functional business hotel. Great breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: What-Katy-Did
Reviews.Content: I booked my hotel through a DFDS Seaways pakage and when I arrived I was upgraded to a double from a twin by the friendly desk staff. Good start! The room was a nice size, with a good size shower and a flat screen TV. I walked everywhere on this trip and managed fine. There are supermarkets nearby and you are pretty close to the canal with the Flea Market. Its about a 10 minute walk to the 'nighlife' and a 20 minute walk to Anne Frank House. The breakfast was great, plenty of scrambled eggs, meats, bread buns, sausages, toasting bread, jams, beans and cereal. There were machines to give you orange juice and hot drinks. A great start to the day. I found the stay pleasant and comfortable, alike it's partners Novotel, which I had used before.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Ibis Hotel, 15-20 min walk from central station”
Reviews.Author: misterlar
Reviews.Content: Good Ibis hotel, though it's a little walk from Central Station (15-20 mins). I was going to stay 2 nights at the Ibis Central Amsterdam (next to the station) but they were sold out of the cheap rooms for one of the nights, so I stayed one night here and one night at the Central Station Ibis. This hotel is actually quite good, though it seems out of place in the neighborhood. It's about a 15-20 min walk from Central Station (not a hard walk). I didn't spend much time in the area (arrived late, left early) but the hotel itself was nice. I generally like the Ibis hotels, and this was no exception. Great staff, nice, clean room just the way I like it. Would definitely stay here again if the Central one is booked. Two things to note though: one, is that while they charge for local calls (as most hotels do), they ALSO charged for 0800 (toll-free) calls (ie, they charge for an "outside line" whether it's toll-free or not). I was using a calling card that had a more expensive rate for their 0800 number access but used it instead thinking there'd be no hotel charge for a 0800 call. Wrong. Ibis hotels charge for outside lines, doesn't matter if it's local or 0800. Also, all Ibis hotels seem to do this: even if you don't want the breakfast (an extra charge) they automatically put it on your bill before checkout, so you've got to tell them AGAIN at CHECK OUT that you did NOT have the breakfast, otherwise you'll be charged for it. For instance, I pre-paid for my room (my Visa card was charged before I even arrived) to get a great price. The price was without breakfast. But when I checked in, it said Breakfast Inlcluded: YES on the check-in card folder, so I thought it was included anyway now. I had breakfast, and when checking out, was told no, it's NOT included at that price, that they automatically add it to the bill and you have to have them take it off at checkout if you don't have breakfast. They were nice and didn't charge me for it because of the mixup, but just be aware, this is one quirk of the Ibis chain (not just this location). If you don't want the breakfast (E10-E15 depending on the location), even if you're already pre-paid, and even if you've told them before you don't want breakfast, you have to AGAIN tell them at CHECKOUT that you haven't had it, and not to charge you for it. It's just a quirk with the Ibis chain. Once you get used to that and the phone thing though, I really DO like the Ibis chain, and this hotel was no exception. I'd definitely stay here again. For those going to Amsterdam, I'd recommend the Central Station location first (just because it's so convenient, and the rooms are nice there too) but if they're booked, and you don't mind walking 15 mins from the station, this was a great hotel too.

Reviews.Title: “Very good and will go back again for the third time”
Reviews.Author: Brewman-here
Reviews.Content: Arrived and was promptly attended to, clean spacious room. Well situated and breakfast was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, efficient, affordable and charmless”
Reviews.Author: monkeysonparade
Reviews.Content: This Ibis follows their formula of a modern, clean, no-frills offering. The room was small but not tiny, with a decent bed and overlooking the backs of some houses. It was quiet and I slept well, my main requirement for a hotel. The restaurant was competent but not overwhelming, and the bar is an OK place for a drink. The location is slightly off the beaten path, but close to my meeting location, which is why I chose it. Don't expect a quaint look into Dutch culture or a little piece of history, however. You will not find it at the Ibis Stopera. It's all business here!

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Clean and Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Beardos
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in a twin room on the 1st floor (Â£70 per night). Room had view over canal, telephone, tv, safe and a 'pod' like shower room bathroom. Cant fault the place really. about a 5 minute walk to get into the centre area with all the bars etc. Didn't try out the hotel food or bar so cant comment on that.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy bed and nice A/C in hot weather”
Reviews.Author: Hev10
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in the Ibis City Stopera in Amsterdam, following using P&O Ferries from Hull. It was 30 degrees, so stifling hot, even the residents thought it was v.hot, so once we got off the coach at central station, we wanted to know where our hotel was so that after a few hours we could go and check in. This is very straight forward as there are signs placed quite high up on the lamposts so you can see which general direction to go in, and all the streets are named so if you can manage to get a little map before you go this should help. We did get a little lost, but found our way - if you head for the science museum named Nemo, this should be on your left and the Ibis is down the street to your right - it is across the road and a couple of buildings down from the fire station. We arrived at 1.15 pm, and even though check in was not until 2 pm, they were able to let us check in early, which was a godsend considering how hot we were. The room (and building) were nicely air conditioned and the bed was really comfy. You do get BBC1 and BBC2 so if you get back to your room later in the evening you can watch the evening news or similar. A visit to the NEMO science museum is good for all ages. A canal trip is also good - several different ones to choose from. We also went to Anne Frank Huis and although this said in our guide book open till 9 pm, it closed at 4.30 pm both the days we were there, we had to queue but only for 30 minutes - there was an entrance for people who had pre booked so if you can book on internet maybe worth doing - it was ok for us as it was hot sunny weather and the little shop round the corner must have made a killing selling cold drinks to us all! If you want to catch a bus or tram, it is best to buy a ticket before you get on as not all buses and trams have ocnductors. Next to central station there is a information centre (called GVB & tickets). You have to take a number from a machine (like a deli counter) and wait your turn, but this was really helpful to us a the man we spoke to was very helpful. We could have bought a return tram/bus combi ticket for 6.50 euros or a 24 hour combi ticket for 7 euro - it's a no brianer really! You just blipin and off the buses - like an octupus card realy each time you get on. He also gave us an information booklet which was really useful as it lists all the attractions and next to them tells you which number bus or tram to get. The public transport system here is really good. A word of warning - don't have a drink in the Ibis bar! one pint og Heinken and a barcardi brezer (he didn't know what peach snapps was) cost us 12 euros! I think if we had known the price we would have gone elsewhere. There is also a left luggage facility at the Ibis so after we checked out, we left our backpacks with them rather than carry them around with us. For anyone travelling with P&O - the coach took 2 hours to get us to Amstrerdam from Rotterdam - horrendous traffic and 2 hours 20 mins toget back - even worse traffic, but it was a Friday night at rush hour! If I went again I would definately book the coach as not sure where the train station was even though I looked for it. Check in at Rotterdam was quite chaotic as not enough staff, but I think they take this into account and would let you on the ferry anyway! If we went to Amsterdam again I would stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for siteseeing”
Reviews.Author: chokie
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a convenient location and we were able to walk to all of the places we wanted to visited. Our room was clean and in good condition. We also had a lovely view of the canal. What a surprise!

Reviews.Title: “Acessible and Value for Money hotel”
Reviews.Author: SmartTourist
Reviews.Content: I reached Amsterdam when the winter was about to come. I took a taxi from the airport and and reached Ibis stopera. First time I was staying in Ibis chain and was not sure about their service and room quality standards. The room I got was as per my choice a high floor room but I could not get the road facing room due to heavy booking those days. The room was small (infact smaller than my home study room) but was nicely organized. the furniture was decent and it had a small safe also to keep the valuables. The missing thing from the room was a refrigerator that I missed a lot. The toilet was again small. The hotel was aceesible and infact was near to the world class science museum and main canal. The railway station was also not very far. It was also near the famous red light area of Amsterdam and a large store for any daily needs shoppings. The restaurant and cafe of the hotel was good and the food variety was excellent. I missed the swimming pool in the hotel as it would have fun in case it is there. Internet was available in rooms but bit free, infact it was a bit costlier to use but I had no option but to use it anyway. The room rent is very reasonable and more than justifies the small rooms and toilets. The staff was good but in patches. Some of the staff members, specially the one at the cafe was rude and got irritated by customers frequently. Overall, the expereince was good and I would reccomend tjhis hotel for budget travellers who need good accessibility from key attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonJames2050
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay here as it was clean and comfortable. The staff were very helpful and freindly. The location was great it only took about 15 minutes to walk to the area of Central Station. It was a good quiet location. A couple of times we got a taxi to venues from it. There is a good supermarket around the corner and restuarants/bars are fairly close.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean, Modern. Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: pearlyLondon
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Amsterdam. A great Hotel. About a 15-20 minute walk from Central Station, so close to all the sights and the centre of Amsterdam. The Hotel is modern with excellent, knowledgable staff which were always willing to answer your questions without too much trouble. We had a first floor room overlooking the canal, with a lovely view of the canal. It was nice to see the boats go past! The rooms are small, but more than adequate for a short stay. King Size comfortable bed, which makes a pleasant change. The bathroom is compact but with a fantastic power shower. We hired some bikes for two days from Mac Bike which is located just around the corner 14 euros for 24hr rental. A truly challenging experience riding around the city, you have to have eyes in the back of your head. Got to see lots more of Amsterdam, found different parks and markets. Even found a windmill this time. The breakfast was brilliant, plenty of choice. Scrambled, eggs, sausages, beans, fresh fruit salad, different cereals, bread and cakes. A bit pricey 12 euros. Definately recommend this hotel, as its clean, great location and good value for money. We found an argentinian restaurant near the flower market, where you could eat as many ribs as you could physically fit it, all for 13 euros. Well worth the money. Included chips and salad..

Reviews.Title: “A Great Amsterdam Experience - Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DanLeesh
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we could see we made a good choice. This is really a top notch Ibis. This hotel is very modern, clean and has all the amenities you need. Firstly the staff here would put some 5 star European Hotels to shame.....They were great. Very helpful and nothing at all was too much trouble. The room was your standard Ibis room, but was new, very clean and had a great view of the canals (Make sure you request a room with canal views when you book). The room came with free breakfast that was truthfully one of the best we experienced in Europe. Cooked Food, Toast with Jam, Juices, Pastries, Cereal and Tea/Coffe. A really good variety. The restuarant downstairs was great with good coffee and hot chocolate and apple strudel. The only very minor negative is the location is about 20 mins walk from the train station at best. Although there are no issues in daytime I would use caution walking around the immediate vicinity at night as it is a little distance from the more frequented areas and we felt a little unsafe at times coming back at night. No free internet. I would suggest you would find it hard to get better value for money in the Amsterdam area.....We would stay here again in an instant.

Reviews.Title: “Handy hotel within walking distance of it all.”
Reviews.Author: NateCambs
Reviews.Content: Typical Ibis room - slightly less plastic than previous experiences! Clean room and great shower (although it did flood the bathroom). Only complaint is that the room was very hot and the A/C was not working and that the bar was Â£Â£Â£ not helped by the exchange rate I know but Â£5 for a medium bottle of water??

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: Chicca23
Reviews.Content: The hotel is newly renovated, rooms are small and simple but very clean. No luxury but very much OK especially for a short stay. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The only disadvantage is that the hotel doesn't have parking so parking is possible either on the street (very expensive) or in a nearby garage which is closed for the night and costs extra. Location is good, all in walking distance to the main attractions of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kitsunegari
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for a couple of nights. It is close to central station (10 min walk). We arrived early (a couple of hours before check in allowed) and were just going to drop the bags off before coming back after lunch, however, our room was ready so we went straight up. Rooms are small and basic but clean. The room had a fair sized bathroom for a budget hotel (with very good shower), air conditioning and flat screen TV with plenty of free channels. Breakfast was excellant, usual cold meats, cheese, breads, pasteries etc but also provided beans,sausages, scrambled and bolied eggs. We were both very impressed with the cleanliness of the hotel and the friendliness of its staff. The only downside was no tea/coffee making facilites in the rooms - but i would still give it 10 out of 10.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel that is super clean for an amazing price!”
Reviews.Author: jason1610
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed there in two rooms with three adults and three young children. While the rooms are smaller by American standards they were a good size by European standards. The hotel seems like it is brand new and everything was super clean and well taken care of. The staff was amazing and looked after our every need. Breakfast was included in the price of our stay (a special rate), but it was a good breakfast and very convenient. The location is fairly close to everything, but far enough away to be quite and relaxing on your return. The one down side is that there are not many dining choices in the immediate area which is difficult with small children. But within a 5-10 minute walk there are all kinds of choices. In the end this was a great hotel, in a great location, and at an amazing price.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, very good price quality standard”
Reviews.Author: Steven D
Reviews.Content: I regularly stay in this hotel, as I go to Amsterdam on business twice a month. It isn't of course a Marriot, but you get what you pay for, and more. If you compare it to a smaller, more quant hotel in Amsterdam, for this price you are getting, good "standard" location. I know of hotels in amsterdam that are more expensive and not nearly as good. The double bed in the single room is excellent. Everything is clean, good service and nice breakfast. The location is also superb, in walking distance of both the hustle and bustle of the historic centre and the central station, but the rooms, especially, canal side are very quiet. For a business, no nonsense, no worry stay I would fully recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good area. Clore Central Station.”
Reviews.Author: rankfussa
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights in this hotel. I reserve the site, and used the rate Hot Deals. (Paid by credit card). I had no problems with the reservation made earlier by the internet. Easy way and fast to booking Accor Hotels. Rates is not resonable with the hotel, but is resonable with Amsterdam rates. This Hotel, its a tipycal Ibis Hotel. Breakfast is simple but good. Good Location, have a Central Station close, Market, and Stores. Parking is close Hotel (not by accor), but don't open before 10:00 am (not good to me), and isn't cheap. I didn't like this parking. (But It's safe). Cleaning its acceptable. My room had a strong smell of cigarette. Staff polite and speak English fluently. Its a good choise, but if you have another deal, think about before booking.

Reviews.Title: “would recommend....”
Reviews.Author: NurseFloNightingale
Reviews.Content: This IBIS stopera is not quaint, nor boutique hip and trendy, but the rooms were sufficiently sized, the staff were pleasant and helpful, the double bed was immensely comfortable, the bathroom/shower were great, and the location was good (in that it was close enough to the hustle and bustle, but quiet enough to be restful). The only issue we had was with remodelling works going on in the hotel which created some mess and daytime noise, but in no way spoiled our stay. Remodelling is progress and an investment! I'd definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: ana29
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 4 days for a New Year's trip. The hotel's location is really very convenient. It is not in a busy street, so it is not noisy during the night, but it is only about 10 minutes walk away from the city centre, what is excellent indeed. We had a double-bedroom, which was small, but still large enough and very clean. The beds are comfortable. There was a large TV-set in the room and no mini-bar at all, but there is a large supermarket very, very close to the hotel, where you can buy drinks. There were two machines with coffee and other drinks in the lobby, but both were out of order. The bathroom is very small, but so cute, I liked it very much, with a huge shower-cabin. There is no hair-drier available in the room, but you can borrow one at the reception-desk. Breakfast was included and very good. Hotel staff is very polite and helpful. The room and the bathroom were cleaned every morning and towels were changed regularly. I would certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent!”
Reviews.Author: dolomoon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great for a cheap getaway to Amsterdam. The only thing I had against it, was the location. The location was ok during the day, it was close to one of the tram lines, so very convenient. However, at night, a girl walking around is not the best idea. It was very strange at night. The room itself was great, we had a double, which was pretty big, breakfast included. The only thing is that they needed to spray the bathroom a bit better, because when we got there it smelled like a wet dog, granted pets are allowed. Besides that the room was very clean, there was A/C (which from my travels through out Europe, is a big luxury). If you need one with a better location, I would definitely look into the Ibis Hotel Centre.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location.”
Reviews.Author: Ferris22
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Ibis for 2 nights recently. The location is great - central enough to be convenient, but far enough away from the main highlights to be peaceful. It's off the main road, coming away from the train station to the left. There is another Ibis very near to the train station, but this doesn't have triple rooms. The room itself was compact, but clean, warm and the bathroom (or should I say 'bath'pod') was fab - the shower was powerful and there's good light in there, even though there's no window. There are no drinks / drink machines in the room, so I would recommend you take these - there are vending machines in the lobby, but these are pricey. The breakfast wasn't included in the deal and for the choices on offer, I felt 14Euros was a bit too much - I guess it's the same as most hotel chains though. The staff are very helpful and knowledgeable. I would probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, reasonably good location”
Reviews.Author: bgosma
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week in July in a triple room. We had a room on the ground floor, with a window to an inside patio. The room was a bit small for three single beds. One of the beds was shoved under the window and not very comfortable. The room was clean, and the bathroom was also clean. The shower had very good water pressure, although it did not evacuate all that fast. The service was very good, very nice people at the front desk. The hotel is located near the centre, you can walk everywhere from the hotel. It's not in a very populated street, so it's not noisy at all. The price was very good. All in all, a very pleasant stay. This is a bare basics hotel, exactly what we needed, and just what you come to expect from an Ibes hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good all round hotel”
Reviews.Author: spud5432154321
Reviews.Content: top hotel not single a complaint staff very professional and rooms really nice and very clean food at breakfast time is very nice also

Reviews.Title: “No problems, Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Moody751
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights. Room was small but clean. Breakfast buffet was fine. Online reservation looked like it was included but was actually itemized on final bill (we did not pay for the mornings we did not eat) Occasional dinner/drink in the restaurant/bar downstairs was perfectly OK. Front desk staff helpful and friendly. One night there were loud noises in the corridor at 1am but that can happen anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “A great base to explore Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: CharlieDave
Reviews.Content: For those familiar with the Ibis chain of hotels I shouldn't have to explain that these are 3 star family style hotels that are based on a pretty basic formula. Our room was bigger than average and faced onto a canal that runs at the back of the hotel. It was peaceful and the view was very pleasant. We had chosen this hotel for its central location and were able to walk to all the major sights in the city which is a great advantage. Although the hotel doesn't have a garage they were able to organise parking close by at a reasonable daily rate (by Amsterdam standards!). Breakfast was the usual buffet arrangement but did also include a selection of hot dishes. We had dinner in the hotel on the first night and the food was simple and sensibly priced. Essentially, this is a well run, no frills establishment with very friendly staff that is extremely well located.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable stay at the stopera”
Reviews.Author: todareistodo
Reviews.Content: just arrived back 12 september,from amsterdam,typical ibis hotel,good position,nice walks to main tourist areas of amsterdam,good sized room,nice pod style bathroom,excellent shower 15 mins walk from central station,train from airport 3euro80cents single,20 minute journey.as with most cities just be aware of who is about,we had no problems at all,but keep vigilant.all.in all would reccomend the ibis stopera,and amsterdam to everyone well worth a visit.NB.there is an ibis right next to central station this is not the stopera!!the breakfast buffet in the hotel was 14 euro,but plenty of cafes in walking distance

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need”
Reviews.Author: Rathskeller
Reviews.Content: The Ibis Stopera was a great little hotel. The hotel was clean and neat, the neighborhood is safe and easy to get to, near Waterooplein. Itâ€™s about a mile walk from the Central Train Station though thereâ€™s a tram and a metro stop a few blocks away. Thereâ€™s a big supermarket right around the corner (which was nice) and a bakery a few blocks past that. Thereâ€™s a bar/restaurant in the hotel which was one of the highlights -- both the food and the service were outstanding. The staff was great with our two kids and allowed my wife and I to have something close to a â€œrealâ€� meal out for a change. The prices in the hotel and the restaurant were decent value for money, though nothing in Amsterdam is exactly cheap. The rooms are your standard Ibis chain rooms â€“ neat, clean and a bit on the small side. But the staff set up a baby cot in our triple room (another thanks for the staff) and we made it work. Bathrooms were very small but nice, and I have to agree with a previous reviewer on the excellent showers. My family and I enjoyed our stay at the Ibis and weâ€™d recommend it to friends staying in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “All you'd expect from an Ibis in a good location”
Reviews.Author: baquinn
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights in this hotel.Its a typical Ibis chain hotel,clean and efficient.The location is great,only 10 minutes from the restaurants and bars on Nieuwmarkt.Very close to tram and metro stops too.Our room had a great canal view.Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied with the service”
Reviews.Author: becca108
Reviews.Content: My cousins and I just returned from a trip to Amsterdam. We shared a triple room and it was reasonably spacious. I liked that the room was clean and when we called for help with the safety deposit box and asked for a hair dryer, they came within 5 minutes. It was in a quiet neighborhood but still close enough to the heart of the city. (approx. 15 min walk to central station and 10 min to dam square) Few min walk to metro and tram stations. Just be aware to read the fine print when it tells you that breakfast is included. We didn't get breakfast until the 3rd day (we thought it was included everyday).

Reviews.Title: “Best avoid unless heavy smoker”
Reviews.Author: midnightblue228
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Holland. Stayed 2 nights at Ibis Amsterdam Stopera. Terrible experience. Never ever again. I booked this hotel through Ibis website. Paid Euro 178.5 for 2 nights. Before booking it, I have gone through reviews on Tripadviser. I chose it because of its location and price range. I booked a non-smoking rooom for 2 nights. We checked in around 2pm. The room was stink!! like a hevey smoker room. The room faced a main road. Either we opened the window trying to get rid of the smell, but noise from the main road or we had a peace and quiet night, but hold our breath as long as possible. We went to talk to receptionist, but we were told 'there was not non-smoking room available. This was rather strange considering checking in time 2pm onwards and we checked in 2.30pm. I thought that perhaps it was full, ok, fair enought.The following morning, we contacted the receptionist again. This time the staff said that there was not non-smoking room in this hotel! Is it possibile? The staff did not offer any help, neither friendly. they looked us as if we were the one making all the fuss! Is it too much to ask for a NON-SMOKING room while staying. I won't recommend to friend.

Reviews.Title: “A good deal”
Reviews.Author: JBCB
Reviews.Content: Good location in a quiet part of town. Service was very good. It's a typical Ibis Hotel nothing fancy but clean and good value. We got a good deal on a triple room. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Recomend -”
Reviews.Author: racerBrazil
Reviews.Content: Great location, 5 blocks from downtown. Supermarket 1 block, clean, safe, tied, room ok, bathroom bit small. We liked and would stay there again. AMERICANS DONÂ´T FORGET TO BRING a plug to connect your camera charger, notebook (UL to CE), ...., because they have no one to lend you. I bought at AURORA shop paid 5E and lost one day of pics.....

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous view and location”
Reviews.Author: LadyC81
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a triple room just before Christmas. Typical chain hotel, tiny room with no tea making facilities, but the view couldn't be beaten - ALWAYS recommend a canal view. The shower was awesome too. The best thing was the location - a hop, skip and jump from everywhere you need to be, but quiet enough to feel the real Amsterdam. Highly recommend it - especially the very handsome man at the 'Old Rickety House' pub around the corner. Will definately be back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Good clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jerseymick
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights, paid 79euros a night, which is excellent value for Amsterdam. Clean, modern and decent location. This was a football trip so it was ideal for a big party of blokes, if it was me and the wife, I would probably choose one of the small family run hotels, were you get a little bit more of the true Amsterdam. But this was ideal for this trip, easy to get to all the attractions and tram stop 2 minutes away on foot.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Booniebaby
Reviews.Content: The Ibis hotel chain are generally very good value for money and this hotel was no exception. The hotel is immaculate, the staff always friendly and helpful, the rooms spotless and the restaurant serves nice food and drink. The rooms are as spacious as you need with a large comfortable bed, flat screen TV (with several english channels), lovely views over the canal, full length mirror and brilliant shower room. The rooms have obviously been renovated fairly recently and have been done to a high standard, the pod style shower room is a great idea! The hotel is located about 10 minutes walk from the Rembrant Square and tram lines are a few minues walk away. There's great restaurants (try L'Opera in the Rembrant Square), nice bars (try De Kroon also in Rembrant Square) and we'd go back in a flash!

Reviews.Title: “Ibis is OK”
Reviews.Author: Platt10
Reviews.Content: Had some Air Miles spare so we spent Friday through to Monday at the Ibis Stopera. Located about 10 minutes from centre (more if your looking for the 'red light district'!) and therefore noise free while sleeping. The hotel is very clean and has a 'pod' for a bathroom! Only downside to this is the lack of bath though the shower was excellent. Rubbish tele but new flat screens were being delivered while we left and who goes to Amsterdam to watch tele in their room anyway! The breakfast was self service and plenty of choice though the cooked bits didn't include bacon. Maybe i'm just too 'English' Meals were available in the evening from the bar though they weren't cheap. Staff were friendly and helpful. Only other comment is the lack of tea and coffee making facilities in the room. Overall would definitely reccomend for those seeking an averaged priced place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Superb12
Reviews.Content: Getting there; If arriving at Amsterdam Central, just get the metro 2 stops to Waterlooplein Stn ( they all go to this one ) cost Euro 1.60. approx 5 min walk easy to find. Hotel; Modern on main street, quick check in, provided with keycard for access to lift and room. Rooms modern, clean and have tv, aircon/heating. The shower room is great and consists sink,toilet and an amazing large walk in shower. Breakfast if its included in your deal is comprehensive, hotel has vending machines. Vincinity; Easy walk to Dam Square, just turn right out of hotel, to junction, turn right again, past supermarket, over canal bridge and 1st left ( you will see lights across road and lots of shops, just follow this narrow street and it will get busier as you approach Dam Square. Easy walk to Rembrantplein just go straght ahead at 1st junction ( instead of right) past Waterlooplein metro and over canal bridge and straight on, try the Three Bells pub, good beer,food and music. If you want local just cross the road from hotel to left, up the road at side of fire/police stn and you will find some local pubs/restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely "Stopera" again!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: EmDar07
Reviews.Content: As the title suggests I definitely would stop here again, in fact have already booked another break staying here in January.. this time with the wife (apples to an orchard)!!!!!!!!! Staff were very friendly and more than helpful. Breakfast was buffet style and very substantial, would set you up for the days walking! Rooms were very clean and tidy and housekeeping called daily with fresh towels. I had read previous reviews about the shower/bathroom pods and all true, they are the biz!! Didn't get the canal view this time but getting in at 6 in the morning i wasn't that upset,there's always January!!!Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and good hotel..quiet”
Reviews.Author: Houston2tall
Reviews.Content: I was suprised how clean and comfortable this budget hotel is. Room was small but acceptable. The staff was friendly and helpful. The resturant was a bit pricey but good food. Phone calls to the US were reasonable price. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location , Clean”
Reviews.Author: bopps
Reviews.Content: Myself and my boyfriend stayed here for three nights during the summer. As we were not staying too long in Amsterdam we wanted somewhere convienent to the night life, restaurants shops etc. This hotel met all such requirements. We walked everywhere we wanted to go, and Amsterdam is a lovely city to walk around. We were no more than ten minutes from all the action, yet the hotel was quite at night with very few passers by. The actual room was basic but very clean and comfortable. They made great use of the space especially in the bathroom and we had a lovely view of one of the canals. Hotel was also great value for money. Perfect. We didn't really eat in the hotel largely due to the fact that we ate while we were out and about so i cannot comment on the food. Staff were friendly and accommodating. It was the ideal place for us to stay. enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us...great value”
Reviews.Author: Mooles
Reviews.Content: Stayed here end of august/beginning sept 2007 for 4 nights. The rooms - yes they are fairly basic but for the price I can only praise the Ibis. The ensuites are like little 'pods' but are ingenius and have a fantastic walk in shower. We looked onto a canal which I definitely suggest asking for if they can accommodate this. The staff were nothing short of excellent therefore if you have any problems you always have help at hand. Breakfast was plentiful - with hot and continental breakfast. About a 10-15 min walk from the centre - which we don't mind - but you seem to be there in no time at all. Definitely worth a short walk to save quite a substantial amount of money. Can only recommend the hotel - I'd definitely return after looking at some of the prices of other hotels that are a little more central.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely located hotel to explore Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Polojo
Reviews.Content: My stay at the IBIS Stopera was very good and I give it top marks for location, access, hospitality and functionality. For UK residents, the IBIS Stopera in Amsterdam is the equivalent of the Travel Inn, Travel Lodge or Holiday Inn Express. Rooms are standard with a double bed with en-suite decent shower and toilet facilities. The hotel is 15 â€“ 20 walk to the city centre, 10 min walk to RLD and 5 min walk to the underground train station and overland tram. Getting there from Schiphol is easy. Take the train from Schiphol to Amsterdam Central. At Amsterdam Central take the underground to Waterlooplein (Second stop). If all goes well the whole journey is one hour from Schiphol. Buy a return ticket at Schiphol if you know when you are returning (Itâ€™s â‚¬3.60 each way). I will also suggest that you buy a 24hr, 48hr or 72 hr travel card, as it can be used on the bus, tram or underground. If you do sleep light, then I suggest you request a canal view room. There are no tea or coffee making facilities but there is a supermarket minutes away. The controlled TV has CNN, BBC1, BBC2, MTV and Eurosport. There is air conditioning as well. To go on the Internet you can use the PAYG computers in reception or buy Wireless Hotspot Pass (â‚¬5.95 for 60 min) if you want to gain access using your Laptop. I had wireless connectivity in my room, which was quite good. I did not have breakfast and they donâ€™t try to impose it on you as hotels do in England (Food is cheaper elsewhere). On the whole I enjoyed my stay here and if you are not fussed about being waited on, lush surroundings but want a very decent, clean place to stay then the IBIS will not be a bad choice. I will go back if I go to Amsterdam again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for weekend break”
Reviews.Author: clairey-loo
Reviews.Content: I booked the Ibis Stopera after trying to find a traditional Dutch B&B for a decent price but with no success. Amsterdam is a very expensive place to stay and you really don't get what you pay for. Although the Ibis Stopera seems expensive compared to other Ibis hotel in european cities, the value compared to other chain hotels and small B&Bs in the area is exceptional. we paid 330 euros for 3 nights room only. The rooms are modern, a good size, cleaned spotlessly, everything in the room in great condition.. as are the hallways, restaurant and foyer. We were at the front of the hotel on the main road and the noise of the cars was not an issue as the rooms are double glazed. We were in room 319. Ate in the restaurant hotel once and service was friendly and swift. One thing to note is that the rooms do not have hairdryers, this was my only negative. Location of the hotel is ideal for city breakers. Right by the Zoo and aquarium, diamond factory, rembrandthuis and about 2 mins away from Macbike, the city's largest bike rental. journey into the very centre of town takes about 10 mins strolling, pleasant walk and no dodgy areas. Highly recommended. would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: startech
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this great Hotel last week for 3 nights. The rooms were clean, fuctional and quiet. had agreat view of a canal fro our 5th floor room. The cubical washroom was great as was the large shower. The staff were exellent as was the singing barman. My wife recomends the hot choclate.And the cold beer is great after a day in town. Which is about 20-25 minute walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: Treva
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 4 nights in July. The hotel is pretty close the the city central and is about a block away from Metro and Tram stops, not to mention about 5 minute walk from one of the cool Town Squares in Amsterdam. We got a pretty decent rate of 99 Euros a night( 141 Euros for the weekends), which isn't bad for Amsterdam since hotels that close into town seem to be pricey. The hotel was clean and easily accessible. But dont get it mistaken, it is a no frills hotel. The walls are very thin so I was woken every morning by the sounds of the staff cleaning in the hallways. This was usually between 10 and 10:30 so if you don't sleep in late, its not a problem. The beds were nicely designed, but were very hard and I had a bit of trouble sleeping on them. Not a deal breaker but should be noted. The bathrooms very very compact but surprisingly since they were designed so well, you didn't notice. The breakfast, well, it was included and it was pretty bad. I am usually not picky with eating, especially when its free, but to put it bluntly, I only ate there once and then bought breakfast from then on at outdoor restaurants. There is Internet access but you have to pay for a pre-paid card. staff was nice and accommodating and they even corrected a problem on my bill without argument. They made it worth it. Also the cleaning of the rooms was great as well. All in all, I would stay there again if i had to but I would probably shop around for a little different experience first

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding A Real Gem”
Reviews.Author: DLODRATSAB
Reviews.Content: I spent four nights in this quality hotel 4-8 May 2007 .I was very impressed with all aspects of the service I received .Checking in was a breeze and the standard of the room was exceptional .The room was spotless and cleaned to a very high standard throughout my stay .The room featured a huge power shower and a king size bed .My package included breakfast which was served in the bar area .Lots of choice of hot and cold food. The hotel is very central being about 10 minutes walk from central station or a short cab ride .The busy centre of Amsterdam is only a short walk away .The best thing about this hotel I think are the staff .I went to reception several times with various enquiries and was always met with a smile and faultless assistance .The same in the bar where the service was swift and friendly. Although on a busy road the rooms were quiet .I will be returning to Amsterdam shortly and will certainly be staying in this lovely friendly hotel. Recommended

Reviews.Title: “overpriced”
Reviews.Author: INDEPENDANTTRAVELLER
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel direct with ibis and paid â‚¬334 for two nights for two with breakfast. What we liked best was the breakfast, it was buffet style with something for everyone, cold and hot food fresh coffee, juice and a selection of teas. I read lots about how nice the shower was in this hotel and yes the shower is lovely, hot and powerful, just what you need when you've been walking all day. However, the bathroom was like a unit that had been fitted in to the room, it was all plastic and felt a bit like an oversized caravan bathroom! We've stayed in several ibis hotels and i don't remember anything like this before. The room itself was what you might call functional, the usual twin beds pushed together that they call a double room, TV with several language channels. A full length mirror but the electric socket was on the other side of the room so very difficult to dry your hair. No tea or coffee but we knew that before we went. Several reviews mention noise but we didn't hear any at all. It was very quiet, a welcome respite from the city centre. Not much going on in the area at all. The bar man was very keen to close up on the two nights we stayed, it was the same man both nights, the first night we arrived quite late and i think he was disappointed that we arrived. the second night we got back at 20 to 1 (it's advertised as being open till 1) only to be told that they were closing early as there was no one there) it's hardly the place you'd want to sit all night but plenty of people must want to have a nightcap before bed. Overall I think it's a basic hotel, handy to be a little out of the centre but too expensive for what you get. Ibis hotels in other big cities are not this expensive

Reviews.Title: “diissapointed”
Reviews.Author: Heddwch
Reviews.Content: Read your views by other customers. We arrived and I asked if there was breakfast included. We where told no. We stayed three nights. There was no tea and coffee facilities. I could not wash my hair no hairdryers in the room. We booked for three adults one being my 6`2 tall son. He had a small bed only suitable for a child. We paid for the breakfast the first morning it was 11 euros each.=When we had the final bill it was 120 euros for two nights. The last night was 189 euros breakfast had been included. We told then we had no breakfast and the staff where unfreindly and didnt alter the bill. We did try to explain we where told it didnt include breakfast on arrival and so ate out. They where most rude and uncaring.

Reviews.Title: “Great affordable place in pricey Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: Peter123452
Reviews.Content: This is a very good 3 star hotel located in the center of Amsterdam. It is a typical Ibis, similar to other Ibis hotels around the globe. Room: The room was big in European standards. The bed was ok and the sheets were very clean. The TV had about 30 channels (5 English speaking channels). The bathroom was pretty small, but the shower was big. Bathroom and room were very clean. Service: The entire staff speaks English. They were all very polite and nice. Check in and check out were a breeze. Location: The location is perfect. It is located in the old Jewish area of amsterdam. It is a 5 minute walk to the Rembrandt house, 5 minutes to Waterlooplein and 10 minutes to Rembrandtsplein. Price: A double romm per nighet costs (at this time of the year) about 90 Euros. This is one of the cheapest 3 star hotels in central Amsterdam, and surely one of the best of them.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: mizzmodette
Reviews.Content: My partner and i have just returned from amsterdam,amazing place indeed! We stayed at the ibis stopera hotel for 4 nights,we had an easy,stright forward check in (didnt arrive there till 8pm) the room was clean and comfortable,but was noisey, as we had a room at the front,so next time i will ask for a room at the rear,the shower was wicked,steaming hot water,and big enough for 2 :O) only thing is they dont provide tea or coffee in the room,but i think most hotels out there are the same,we took our own.it was about a 15 min walk to dam square,turn right out of the hotel and stright on,didnt use the resturant,enough places to eat out for cheaper,didnt do the breakfast either.all the staff were polite and helpful,so i recommend you try this hotel,we will be again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lu79
Reviews.Content: The Ibis hotel was a great value for the money. It seemed to be almost new, nice bright colors, spotless bathroom. It had Ikea type furnishings but they served their purpose well. What might seem odd to an American tourist new to European travel, is the size of the room or bathroom, but wait till you see their cars! ;) There was a small restaurant right in the hotel lobby, serving daily breakfast (both hot & cold) for only 5 Euros for hotel guests. It was open late too so incase you get hungry late at night (and it can happen in Amsterdam for one reason or another lol) you don't have to walk too far for a pizza.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: lmac16
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for just one night. Check in and out was efficient and friendly, no problems. Choice of non smoking or smoking room on arrival. There was a left luggage room available but it wasn't locked so be careful with valuables. Location was good, about 10 mins work to main centre but far enough away for a quiet nights sleep. Room was good, plenty of space although I suppose there wouold be a lack of storage space for clothes if you were staying more than a couple of days. Bathroom was fine, massive shower which was nice. All clean and exra pillows and blankets if needed. All good security as you couldnt use the lifts or stairs unless you had a room key. Breakfast was good. Normal choice of breads, cheeses, ham, coffee and juice. Also a couple of hot options including eggs and sausage. Was included in our stay, not too sure how much it was if paying seperately to room. Didnt use bar or restaurant so can't comment on them other than to say looked busy when we returned to the hotel after our evening out which must be a good sign. Overall a good hotel with clean rooms, friendly staff and a good breakfast. Would stay here again without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: spanner42
Reviews.Content: Haven't stayed in a 3* hotel for a while, so the main things that I write may not really be relevant. The 3rd bed wasn't a bed, but a pull down one , that said it was comfortable, but there wasn't much spare room. With 3 adults, the lack of adequate storage space would have been a problem, but we were only there two night so it didn't concenr us this time. Had read previous reviews, so knew there were no tea making facilities, nor hairdryer so came prepared. The room was clean and functional, as was the shower room. We did not try the air conditioning, and our room was at the back overlloking the canal so we had no problems with traffice noise. Everyone was more than helpful and very friendly, would have no probelms staying there again

Reviews.Title: “Great place to explore Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Expat_Girl25
Reviews.Content: I stopped at the Ibis Stopera in Amsterdam at the end of Sept 06 for 3 days & had an extremey pleasant stay. I had been struggling to find a hotel in central Amsterdam that was within my budget & not likely to be full of rowdy stag do's. The Stopera was a little more than I'd wanted to pay, however I knew that an Ibis hotel would be a decent standard. We had a double room on the second floor, which also had an extra single bed in it. The room was cleaned every day & I never heard any noise from any other guests. The shower was amazing - huge & hot! The view from the window wasn't much to write home about, I understand the higher floors are better. It took us 10 minutes to walk into the centre of Amsterdam. I didn't set foot in the bar / restaurant at the hotel - it looked nice enough but it seemed to be very expensive. The only down side for me were the directions given on the Ibis website as to how to get to the hotel by public transport. When we came out of the metro station we were lost! So my advice would be to invest in a map!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ballymaguigan
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Ibis Stopera for 3 nights in September 2006. The hotel was in a good location within walking distance of all the main sights in Amsterdam. The room and bathroom were a good size and very clean. I cannot comment on the food in the hotel as we always ate out as the resturant had high prices compared to other places. I would definity recommend this hotel to anyone going to Amsterdam as it is very reasonable priced compared to other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Super Stopera”
Reviews.Author: Foosterino
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Stopera, I really liked this hotel. Good sized rooms, very helpful and friendly staff and a good breakfast. Ideal for a short break. We had a lovely canal view for our room. Shower was excellent and a good size. TV had a good selection of English channels - BBC 1 and 2.
