Staff were very friendly and helped us with table reservations and taxi bookings. Breakfast served 4am to 12! Good choice of bread and meat. Loved have chocolate sprinkles on my croissants and a type of tea I actually drank.

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdam is great!!”
Reviews.Author: Eejit
Reviews.Content: We stayed between 26th - 29th August and had a quiet room at the back overlooking the canal. Previous reviews have complained about the noise of other guests and the maids cleaning, but we have no complaints on that score. The room was clean and functional, but if you don't like hard beds, then give this place a miss. We have to agree with comment's about the breakfast. For what it is, it is very overpriced. There are loads of cafe's within walking distance ( all of central Amsterdam is) where you can get a better breakfast for less. Tea and coffee making facilities wouldn't go amiss in the rooms also.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed with The Stopera”
Reviews.Author: Feenee
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights as a mini-cruise package from Newcastle Upon Tyne (UK) Taking comments from the reviews into account we requested a room high up at the back and got room 609. Perfect! Great views of the canal and NO noise whatsoever. I'm really surprised that no-one has mentioned the bathrooms! Fabulous! The shower cubicle would hold 4 people (it takes 2 very nicely...) and the shower is great. The hotel is very clean and the room comfortable with bench seats, chair and desk. Bed good. Well decorated. Public areas are a bit souless but I don't understand the comments about breakfast as it is included in all tariffs. Yes- there isn't much variety but lots of rolls, juice, jams, cheeses, cold meats. Tasteless scrambled eggs and chipolatas. The local area is not particularly nice but there is fabulous supermarket- turn right outside the hotel and right again at the junction. The walk to the start of town centre action is only 10 minutes. By the way- internet access is free if you have a laptop/pda and take the main street left after Rembrandt's house. The cafe half way towards Dam square has open wireless network. Eat next door in the Pints & Plates!

Reviews.Title: “Not Great by Any Means”
Reviews.Author: cmf99
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ibis Stopera for three nights at the end of July for the Rolling Stones concert . I booked the hotel largely based on reviews on this site, breaking my golden rule for short city breaks. I.e that the hotel should be right in the middle of the action. I can only blame myself but I was slightly disappointed. This hotel has a number of problems. Firstly location. It is situated on one of the most non descript streets in Amsterdam, a decent walk from the main nightlife, with very few cafes, bars or shops of any description. It is not much fun walking back late at night through deserted streets. The street outside the hotel, despite having a lot of traffic has virtually no public transport either. Having been in Amsterdam before I thought this slightly offside location would guarantee a decent nights sleep but the hotel is popular with the British stag trip crowd so you can expect to be woken between 4 and 5 at weekends by slamming doors and drunken voices singing the virtues of "Inger-lund" If the Brits dont wake you then the housekeeping will. The second issue are the prices. The room rates are not too bad for cental Amstaerdam (although this is stretching the idea of central) but everything else is expensive. Breakfast is a bit pricey at 13 euros (and quite mediocre) whereas internet acces in the lobby at 5 euros for 15 minutes is a total ripoff. Although the hotel is clean and fresh, the public areas are extremely souless and joyless.The bar/restaurant is possibly the least cosy I have experienced in many years of travelling. Leave this hotel to the tour groups and the lager louts. Chris Stockholm

Reviews.Title: “Clean & convenient”
Reviews.Author: tiktok9
Reviews.Content: We chose this Ibis hotel after reading many reviews for different accomodations in Amsterdam on trip advisor. We (myself & two female friends) got a triple room for 109 Euro/night which was pretty reasonable. The hotel isn't right at the center of town but I found it to be less hectic than the touristy area. It was a two city block walk from the tram stop which isn't bad unless you have heavy luggage (like we did). The hotel was clean like any other chain hotel and the front desk staff members were friendly. We got a room on the back side of the hotel, bottom floor. I really felt like it was a cabin on a cruise ship! It was small, with a teeny bathroom and was right on the canal! But it was cozy and I have no complaints about the room in general. The only complaint I have is about a large group of tourist making a huge ruckus in the morning on our floor. I think that a lot of tourist groups stay here, so be forewarned about the potential for noisy neighbors. We felt safe walking to/from the hotel. There is a grocery store about a block away.

Reviews.Title: “OK but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: The Traveller SR
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is in an ideal position. It is far enough away from the centre but is only a 30 minute walk to Ann Franks house which is the other side of the central part of Amsterdam. The hotel and rooms are clean and tidy although they never removed used coffee cups from the room whilst we were there. We had to bring these up from breakfast as there are no tea making facilities in the room. The breakfast is quite expensive at 13 Euros each and I feel it isn't worth it. Our room was at the back with nice views over a canal which was very quiet. As mentioned in other reviews, there is a good large shower. Overall, the hotel was OK but nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal, Clean and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: watsonfamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ibis Stopera in Amsterdam for our Anniversary. Despite being 10-15 mins walk from Dam Square, its also nice to be out of the hussle and bustle. The staff are very friendly and helpful. Breakfast is Â£8 each, but its on your doorstep, clean and plentiful. We would reccomend Jamie Oliver's Fifteen restaurant (where we went for our Anniversary). Set menu is Â£30 and worth every penny. Also, a superb restaurant on Damraak (just off Dam Square) is "Grouchos" - an Argentinian steak house. Absolutely superb .. and to be honest .. better than ant steak we have EVER had !. Amsterdam is great fun, a lot of walking, and expensive to drink. Even water is 2-3 euros (Â£1.50-2.00) per bottle. Beer/wine is Â£4 just about everywhere. Definately recomend the hotel (ask for a rear room that over looks the canal - nice and quiet) !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Jules163
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Ibis City Stopera from 19-21 May and once we got our bearings, realised we couldn't have booked a hotel in a better location. All areas are accessible either by tram, foot or water taxi and is in a quiet area. The rooms are not huge but I've seen smaller but they are spotless, with one of the most comfortable beds I've stayed in (and you get a quilt !!) The shower takes up most of the space in the bathroom. It's huge, it's also the best shower I've ever had (even better than the one at home). Staff are very friendly and offer a city map and general advice when checking in. Breakfast was listed as "American breakfast" and there was ample to choose from. Cereals, different breads, toast, cooked breakfast, cheese, meat, juices. We arrived earlier than check in and left later than check out and they provide storage space for cases. Regarding previous comments about the hotel being too noisy. Yes, we heard people walking down the corridors, yes we heard other guests doors closing but I've never been to a hotel and not heard such noises. The hotel was full and not everyone goes to bed at the same time so its expected!!! Do I have anything negative to say about the hotel? No it was perfect. Would I stay there again? Definately.

Reviews.Title: “practical and affordable”
Reviews.Author: maquilay
Reviews.Content: ibis hotel as expected always exceeds the hotel guests expectations. we went there to spend my birthday. as expected the rooms were exactly the same ibis rooms i have been to, the room that we had a very nice canal view in the back portion of the hotel area. There are a few things if only are present could have boost my ratings further such as the following: more nearby convenience stores(despite there is a nearby grocery store), tram or bus transports in front of the hotel(because you have to walk a bit further from the hotel to reach waterlooplein metro and tram stations), nearby affordable restaurants and food shops. But overall this hotel is by far good in terms of practicality, affordability and money for value hotel and clean. The staff were very accomdating before i forget. I will come back again to this hotel if ever i come back again to the beautiful city of AMSTERDAM.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern, and well priced”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: OK... Here it is- I'll get to the main points... 1. The hotel is actuallly on a very quiet street. Not far from major attractions but far enough that you can't hear commotion. 2. The hotel is very clean. 3. My husband and I had a queen sized bed. 4. Having an elevator was a definate plus. 5. The bar staff was very rude, and we did not visit the bar but only for a pizza late one evening. I had just read it wasn't the best so we opted to use outside resturants. 6. Housekeeping was a little too eager to clean our rooms at 9:30 in the morning. Hey... at least they cleaned. 7. The bathroom was spotless and the shower was considerably large (great for 2!) 8. We brought our own bath towels and I am glad we did... the hotel towels were rough! 9. Staff was friendly and helpful as to how to get around the city and where to go. 10. Great to have a supermarket and bagel store around the corner. 11. Blue Bird coffee shop in close proximity- our favorite!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy”
Reviews.Author: pete1pike
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 7th of April & found the hotel to be lovely & clean.The problem we found was that there was constant noise from the main road.We slept with earplugs in & even with them you could still hear the traffic.I dont use them ever but found i NEEDED THEM.We loved the bathroom very chic.Due to road noise we wouldnt book in here again

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NVNative
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ibis Stopera last summer, after another booking fell through. I was pleased both with the rate and the room. It was close to everything, and there was a tram stop about two blocks south of the hotel. My room had a lovely view out over the canal behind the hotel, and was large by European standards. The staff was outstanding, and I had a great time chatting with the barman. As a single woman travelling alone, I found it to be safe, quiet, and very clean. I would and have recommended it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Vaule for money”
Reviews.Author: marcus007
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Ibis Stopera for 5 nights from 28 Dec 05 - 3 Jan 06. Like most hotels in Amsterdam during this period the Ibis was booked solid. The last 3-star hotel I stayed at was the Avenue (single room) and I had not been impressed. I was very pleased with our choice this time. The location is great and much closer to Dam square and Central station than I was expecting. It was far enough away from the hustle and bustle to be relaxing and quite peaceful (discounting the unavoidable NYE crackers!), yet close enough to comfortably walk almost everywhere. It was always cold and sometimes snowing during our stay yet we never bothered with trams or taxis and walked everywhere with ease. The rooms are cosy and comfortable. They're not big rooms but they're big enough for two adults and they're modern and clean. At all times we found the staff to be enthusiastic, pleasant, helpful and efficient and all had perfect English. They seemed to be quite a young crew, always well groomed and we thought they did a great job considering they were dealing with a full hotel of mainly other young people who were in Amsterdam for NYE party celebrations (as were we - though not so young!). Yes, as other reviewers have mentioned, noise from the corridor is evident although we found it to only ever be momentary and never found it to be a source of disturbance. Our only complaint would be the lack of tea/coffee making facilities in the room. We knew this to be the case when we booked and thought it wouldn't matter, but once there we really missed this facility and also missed the convenience of a mini-fridge. The Ibis Stopera was great value for money and offers the security of "what you see on the website is what you get". I would recommend it to all, but I think I missed having a kettle and a fridge a bit too much and will probably look for a different hotel next time just so as to have those facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: mimimi
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night, as Ibis Central Station was booked. The room was neat and clean. We had a great view overlooking the canal. The bathroom at Ibis Stopera was much nicer than the one at Central Station. The front desk employees were wonderfully pleasant. I'm picky and I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again! It was an overall great experience!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: TSW42
Reviews.Content: Very nice, stayed in the back block (2 blocks) room was a standard IBIS room, was kept clean and well presented. Staff spoke good english. Would stay again.

HotelInfo.Name: Ibis Amsterdam City Stopera
HotelInfo.Address: Valkenburgerstraat 68, Amsterdam 1011 LZ, The Netherlands
